002BE0r 3  E8                           inx
002BE1r 3               .endif
002BE1r 3  60           z_spi_select: rts
002BE2r 3               
002BE2r 3               ; ## SPI_TRANSCEIVE ( s -- u ) "Send and receive spi data"
002BE2r 3               ; ## "spi_transceive" coded Custom
002BE2r 3               xt_spi_transceive:
002BE2r 3               .ifdef VIA1_BASE
002BE2r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
002BE5r 3               
002BE5r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002BE7r 3               
002BE7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr spi_transceive
002BEAr 3               
002BEAr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x         ; put return value in TOS
002BECr 3  74 01                        stz 1,X         ;reset value there
002BEEr 3               .endif
002BEEr 3  60           z_spi_transceive: rts
002BEFr 3               
002BEFr 3               ; ## SD_INIT ( s -- u ) "Send and receive spi data"
002BEFr 3               ; ## "sd_init" coded Custom
002BEFr 3               xt_sd_init:
002BEFr 3               .ifdef SD
002BEFr 3                               jsr underflow_1
002BEFr 3               
002BEFr 3                               lda 0,x
002BEFr 3                               jsr sd_init
002BEFr 3                               beq @ok
002BEFr 3                               pha
002BEFr 3                               printascii sd_init_error_message
002BEFr 3                               pla
002BEFr 3               @ok:
002BEFr 3                               sta 0,x         ; put return value in TOS
002BEFr 3                               stz 1,X         ;reset value there
002BEFr 3               .endif
002BEFr 3  60           z_sd_init: rts
002BF0r 3               
002BF0r 3               ; ## SD_READSECTOR ( addr d -- u ) "Read SD sector"
002BF0r 3               ; ## "sd_readsector" coded Custom
002BF0r 3               xt_sd_readsector:
002BF0r 3               
002BF0r 3               .ifdef SD
002BF0r 3                               jsr underflow_2
002BF0r 3                               ; get and save sector number (32 bit number, double)
002BF0r 3                               ; most significant part is TOS
002BF0r 3                               lda 0, x
002BF0r 3                               sta IO_SECTOR + 2
002BF0r 3                               lda 1, x
002BF0r 3                               sta IO_SECTOR + 3
002BF0r 3                               ; least significant part is NOS
002BF0r 3                               lda 2, x
002BF0r 3                               sta IO_SECTOR + 0
002BF0r 3                               lda 3, x
002BF0r 3                               sta IO_SECTOR + 1
002BF0r 3                               lda #1
002BF0r 3                               sta SD_CRC
002BF0r 3               
002BF0r 3                               jsr sd_readsector
002BF0r 3                               sta 0,x         ; put return value in TOS
002BF0r 3                               stz 1,X         ;reset value there
002BF0r 3               
002BF0r 3                               inx
002BF0r 3                               inx
002BF0r 3               .endif
002BF0r 3  60           z_sd_readsector: rts
002BF1r 3               
002BF1r 3               
002BF1r 3               ; ## time ( -- addr ) "get time storage address"
002BF1r 3               ; ## "time" coded Custom
002BF1r 3               xt_time:
002BF1r 3                       .ifdef time
002BF1r 3  A9 rr                lda #time
002BF3r 3                       .else
002BF3r 3                       lda #0
002BF3r 3                       .endif
002BF3r 3  CA                   dex
002BF4r 3  CA                   dex
002BF5r 3  95 00                sta 0,x
002BF7r 3  74 01                stz 1,x
002BF9r 3               
002BF9r 3               
002BF9r 3  60           z_time: rts
002BFAr 3               
002BFAr 3               
002BFAr 3               xt_cf_info:
002BFAr 3               .ifdef CF_ADDRESS
002BFAr 3  20 rr rr             jsr cf_info
002BFDr 3  20 rr rr             jsr xt_cr
002C00r 3  20 rr rr             jsr cf_print_id
002C03r 3  20 rr rr             jsr cf_print_capacity
002C06r 3               .endif
002C06r 3               z_cf_info:
002C06r 3  60                   rts
002C07r 3               .ifdef CF_ADDRESS
002C07r 3               cf_print_capacity:
002C07r 3  5A               phy
002C08r 3               
002C08r 3  20 rr rr         jsr xt_cr
002C0Br 3               
002C0Br 3  A0 78            ldy #120
002C0Dr 3                   ; print lba size
002C0Dr 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002C0Fr 3  8D rr rr         sta LBA_SIZE
002C12r 3  C8               iny
002C13r 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002C15r 3  8D rr rr         sta LBA_SIZE + 1
002C18r 3               
002C18r 3  C8               iny
002C19r 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002C1Br 3  8D rr rr         sta LBA_SIZE + 2
002C1Er 3               
002C1Er 3  C8               iny
002C1Fr 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002C21r 3  8D rr rr         sta LBA_SIZE + 3
002C24r 3               
002C24r 3  A0 09            ldy #9
002C26r 3               @loop:
002C26r 3  0E rr rr 2E      asl32 LBA_SIZE
002C2Ar 3  rr rr 2E rr  
002C2Er 3  rr 2E rr rr  
002C32r 3  88               dey
002C33r 3  D0 F1            bne @loop
002C35r 3               
002C35r 3  CA               dex
002C36r 3  CA               dex
002C37r 3  CA               dex
002C38r 3  CA               dex
002C39r 3               
002C39r 3  AD rr rr         lda LBA_SIZE
002C3Cr 3  95 02            sta 2, x
002C3Er 3  AD rr rr         lda LBA_SIZE + 1
002C41r 3  95 03            sta 3, x
002C43r 3  AD rr rr         lda LBA_SIZE + 2
002C46r 3  95 00            sta 0, x
002C48r 3  AD rr rr         lda LBA_SIZE + 3
002C4Br 3  95 01            sta 1, x
002C4Dr 3               
002C4Dr 3  20 rr rr         jsr xt_ud_dot
002C50r 3               
002C50r 3  CA               dex
002C51r 3  CA               dex
002C52r 3  CA               dex
002C53r 3  CA               dex
002C54r 3  A9 06            lda #6
002C56r 3  95 00            sta 0, x
002C58r 3  74 01            stz 1, x
002C5Ar 3  A9 rr            lda #<bytes_msg
002C5Cr 3  95 02            sta 2, x
002C5Er 3  A9 rr            lda #>bytes_msg
002C60r 3  95 03            sta 3, x
002C62r 3  20 rr rr         jsr xt_type
002C65r 3  20 rr rr         jsr xt_cr
002C68r 3  7A               ply
002C69r 3  60               rts
002C6Ar 3               
002C6Ar 3               
002C6Ar 3               cf_info:
002C6Ar 3  20 rr rr         jsr cf_init
002C6Dr 3  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
002C70r 3  A9 EC            lda #$EC
002C72r 3  8D D7 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 7
002C75r 3  A9 rr            lda #<IO_BUFFER
002C77r 3  85 rr            sta io_buffer_ptr
002C79r 3  A9 rr            lda #>IO_BUFFER
002C7Br 3  85 rr            sta io_buffer_ptr + 1
002C7Dr 3  20 rr rr         jsr cf_read
002C80r 3  60               rts
002C81r 3               
002C81r 3               cf_print_id:
002C81r 3                   ; print model number
002C81r 3  5A               phy
002C82r 3  A0 37            ldy #55
002C84r 3               @loop:
002C84r 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002C86r 3  20 rr rr         jsr kernel_putc
002C89r 3  88               dey
002C8Ar 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002C8Cr 3  20 rr rr         jsr kernel_putc
002C8Fr 3  C8               iny
002C90r 3  C8               iny
002C91r 3  C8               iny
002C92r 3  C0 5F            cpy #(40+55)
002C94r 3  90 EE            bcc @loop
002C96r 3  7A               ply
002C97r 3  60               rts
002C98r 3               
002C98r 3               .endif
002C98r 3               xt_io_readblock:
002C98r 3               .ifdef io_read_sector_address
002C98r 3  20 rr rr             jsr underflow_2
002C9Br 3                       ; block-read ( addr blk# -- )
002C9Br 3  B5 02                lda 2, x
002C9Dr 3  85 rr                sta io_buffer_ptr
002C9Fr 3  B5 03                lda 3, x
002CA1r 3  85 rr                sta io_buffer_ptr + 1
002CA3r 3  B5 00                lda 0, x
002CA5r 3  8D rr rr             sta IO_SECTOR
002CA8r 3  B5 01                lda 1, x
002CAAr 3  8D rr rr             sta IO_SECTOR + 1
002CADr 3  9C rr rr             stz IO_SECTOR + 2
002CB0r 3  9C rr rr             stz IO_SECTOR + 3
002CB3r 3               
002CB3r 3  0E rr rr             asl IO_SECTOR                   ; multiply by two to get first sector number
002CB6r 3  2E rr rr             rol IO_SECTOR + 1
002CB9r 3  2E rr rr             rol IO_SECTOR + 2
002CBCr 3               
002CBCr 3                       ; lda io_buffer_ptr
002CBCr 3                       ; sta 0, x
002CBCr 3                       ; lda io_buffer_ptr + 1
002CBCr 3                       ; sta 1, x
002CBCr 3                       ; jsr xt_dot
002CBCr 3               
002CBCr 3  20 rr rr             jsr io_read_sector
002CBFr 3  EE rr rr D0          inc32 IO_SECTOR
002CC3r 3  0D EE rr rr  
002CC7r 3  D0 08 EE rr  
002CD1r 3  E6 rr                inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
002CD3r 3  E6 rr                inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
002CD5r 3  20 rr rr             jsr io_read_sector
002CD8r 3                       ; lda io_buffer_ptr
002CD8r 3                       ; sta 0, x
002CD8r 3                       ; lda io_buffer_ptr + 1
002CD8r 3                       ; sta 1, x
002CD8r 3                       ; jsr xt_dot
002CD8r 3               
002CD8r 3  E8                   inx
002CD9r 3  E8                   inx
002CDAr 3               
002CDAr 3               .endif
002CDAr 3               z_io_readblock:
002CDAr 3  60                   rts
002CDBr 3               
002CDBr 3               xt_io_writeblock:
002CDBr 3               .ifdef io_read_sector_address
002CDBr 3                       ; block-write ( addr blk# -- )
002CDBr 3  20 rr rr             jsr underflow_2
002CDEr 3  B5 02                lda 2, x
002CE0r 3  85 rr                sta io_buffer_ptr
002CE2r 3  B5 03                lda 3, x
002CE4r 3  85 rr                sta io_buffer_ptr + 1
002CE6r 3  B5 00                lda 0, x
002CE8r 3  8D rr rr             sta IO_SECTOR
002CEBr 3  B5 01                lda 1, x
002CEDr 3  8D rr rr             sta IO_SECTOR + 1
002CF0r 3  9C rr rr             stz IO_SECTOR + 2
002CF3r 3  9C rr rr             stz IO_SECTOR + 3
002CF6r 3               
002CF6r 3  0E rr rr             asl IO_SECTOR                   ; multiply by two to get first sector number
002CF9r 3  2E rr rr             rol IO_SECTOR + 1
002CFCr 3  2E rr rr             rol IO_SECTOR + 2
002CFFr 3               
002CFFr 3  20 rr rr             jsr io_write_sector
002D02r 3  EE rr rr D0          inc32 IO_SECTOR
002D06r 3  0D EE rr rr  
002D0Ar 3  D0 08 EE rr  
002D14r 3  E6 rr                inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
002D16r 3  E6 rr                inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
002D18r 3  20 rr rr             jsr io_write_sector
002D1Br 3               
002D1Br 3               
002D1Br 3                       ; inc io_buffer_ptr + 1           ; jump two pages forward
002D1Br 3                       ; inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
002D1Br 3                       ; jsr io_write_sector
002D1Br 3  E8                   inx
002D1Cr 3  E8                   inx
002D1Dr 3                       ; inx
002D1Dr 3                       ; inx
002D1Dr 3               .endif
002D1Dr 3               z_io_writeblock:
002D1Dr 3  60                   rts
002D1Er 3               xt_set_ram_expansion_address:
002D1Er 3               .ifdef ENABLE_RAM_EXPANSION
002D1Er 3               .if ENABLE_RAM_EXPANSION = 1
002D1Er 3               ; set slot where RAM extension is located
002D1Er 3  20 rr rr             jsr underflow_1
002D21r 3  B5 00                lda 0, x
002D23r 3  85 rr                sta ram_expansion_address
002D25r 3  B5 01                lda 1, x
002D27r 3  85 rr                sta ram_expansion_address + 1
002D29r 3  E8                   inx
002D2Ar 3  E8                   inx
002D2Br 3               .endif
002D2Br 3               .endif
002D2Br 3               z_set_ram_expansion_address:
002D2Br 3  60                   rts
002D2Cr 3               
002D2Cr 3               xt_bank:
002D2Cr 3               .ifdef ENABLE_RAM_EXPANSION
002D2Cr 3               .if ENABLE_RAM_EXPANSION = 1
002D2Cr 3               ; change RAM bank and enable or disable expansion RAM
002D2Cr 3               ; top bit of byte enables the RAM if set
002D2Cr 3  20 rr rr             jsr underflow_1
002D2Fr 3  A5 rr                lda ram_expansion_address
002D31r 3  F0 06                beq @err
002D33r 3  B5 00                lda 0, x                        ; only low byte is used
002D35r 3  92 rr                sta (ram_expansion_address)
002D37r 3  80 05                bra @end
002D39r 3               @err:
002D39r 3  A9 0D                lda #err_ramexp
002D3Br 3  4C rr rr             jmp error
002D3Er 3               @end:
002D3Er 3  E8                   inx
002D3Fr 3  E8                   inx
002D40r 3               .endif
002D40r 3               .endif
002D40r 3               z_bank:
002D40r 3  60                   rts
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               ; END
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               
002D41r 2                   .include "headers.s"          ; Headers of native words
002D41r 3               ; Dictionary Headers for Tali Forth 2
002D41r 3               ; Scot W. Stevenson <scot.stevenson@gmail.com>
002D41r 3               ; First version: 05. Dec 2016 (Liara Forth)
002D41r 3               ; This version: 29. Dec 2018
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               ; Dictionary headers are kept separately from the code, which allows various
002D41r 3               ; tricks in the code. We roughly follow the Gforth terminology: The Execution
002D41r 3               ; Token (xt) is the address of the first byte of a word's code that can be, uh,
002D41r 3               ; executed; the Name Token (nt) is a pointer to the beginning of the word's
002D41r 3               ; header in the Dictionary. There the link to the next word in the Dictionary
002D41r 3               ; is always one cell down from the current word's own nt. In the code itself,
002D41r 3               ; we use "nt_<WORD>" for the nt and "xt_<WORD>" for the xt.
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               ; This gives us the following header structure:
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               ;              8 bit     8 bit
002D41r 3               ;               LSB       MSB
002D41r 3               ; nt_word ->  +--------+--------+
002D41r 3               ;          +0 | Length | Status |
002D41r 3               ;             +--------+--------+
002D41r 3               ;          +2 | Next Header     | -> nt_next_word
002D41r 3               ;             +-----------------+
002D41r 3               ;          +4 | Start of Code   | -> xt_word
002D41r 3               ;             +-----------------+
002D41r 3               ;          +6 | End of Code     | -> z_word
002D41r 3               ;             +--------+--------+
002D41r 3               ;          +8 | Name   |        |
002D41r 3               ;             +--------+--------+
002D41r 3               ;             |        |        |
002D41r 3               ;             +--------+--------+
002D41r 3               ;             |        |  ...   | (name string does not end with a zero)
002D41r 3               ;          +n +--------+--------+
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               ; The Status Byte is created by adding the flags defined in definitions.asm,
002D41r 3               ; which are:
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               ;       CO - Compile Only
002D41r 3               ;       IM - Immediate Word
002D41r 3               ;       NN - Never Native Compile (must always be called by JSR)
002D41r 3               ;       AN - Always Native Compile (may not be called by JSR)
002D41r 3               ;       UF - Contains underflow check
002D41r 3               ;       HC - Has CFA (words created by CREATE and DOES> only)
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               ; Note there are currently two bits unused.
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               ; By default, all existing words can be natively compiled (compiled inline) or
002D41r 3               ; as a subroutine jump target; the system decides which variant to use based on
002D41r 3               ; a threshold the user can set. By default, all user-created words are flagged
002D41r 3               ; never-native. The user can override this by using the always-native word
002D41r 3               ; just after defining their new word.  The NN flag forbids native compiling,
002D41r 3               ; the AN flag forces it.
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               ; The last word (top word in code) is always BYE. It is marked as the last word
002D41r 3               ; by its value of 0000 in its Next Header field. The words are sorted with the
002D41r 3               ; more common ones first (further down in code) so they are found earlier.
002D41r 3               ; Anything to do with output comes later (further up) because things will
002D41r 3               ; always be slow if there is a human involved.
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               ; The initial skeleton of this list was automatically generated by a script
002D41r 3               ; in the tools folder and then sorted by hand.
002D41r 3               
002D41r 3               nt_bye:
002D41r 3  03                   .byte 3         ; length of word strings
002D42r 3  00                   .byte 0         ; status byte
002D43r 3  00 00                .word 0000      ; next word in Dictionary, 0000 signals end
002D45r 3  rr rr                .word xt_bye    ; start of code block (xt of this word)
002D47r 3  rr rr                .word z_bye     ; end of code (RTS)
002D49r 3  62 79 65             .byte "bye"     ; word name, always lower case, not zero-terminated
002D4Cr 3               
002D4Cr 3               
002D4Cr 3               nt_cold:
002D4Cr 3  04 00                .byte 4, 0
002D4Er 3  rr rr rr rr          .word nt_bye, xt_cold, z_cold
002D52r 3  rr rr        
002D54r 3  63 6F 6C 64          .byte "cold"
002D58r 3               .ifdef LCD_BUF
002D58r 3               nt_lcdput:
002D58r 3  06 10                .byte 6, UF
002D5Ar 3  rr rr rr rr          .word nt_cold, xt_lcdput, z_lcdput
002D5Er 3  rr rr        
002D60r 3  6C 63 64 70          .byte "lcdput"
002D64r 3  75 74        
002D66r 3               nt_haslcd:
002D66r 3  06 00                .byte 6, 0
002D68r 3  rr rr rr rr          .word nt_lcdput, xt_haslcd, z_haslcd
002D6Cr 3  rr rr        
002D6Er 3  68 61 73 6C          .byte "haslcd"
002D72r 3  63 64        
002D74r 3               nt_lcdprint:
002D74r 3  08 10                .byte 8, UF
002D76r 3  rr rr rr rr          .word nt_haslcd, xt_lcdprint, z_lcdprint
002D7Ar 3  rr rr        
002D7Cr 3  6C 63 64 70          .byte "lcdprint"
002D80r 3  72 69 6E 74  
002D84r 3               .endif
002D84r 3               nt_cls:
002D84r 3  03 00                .byte 3, 0
002D86r 3               .ifdef LCD_BUF
002D86r 3  rr rr rr rr          .word nt_lcdprint, xt_cls, z_cls
002D8Ar 3  rr rr        
002D8Cr 3               .else
002D8Cr 3                       .word nt_cold, xt_cls, z_cls
002D8Cr 3               .endif
002D8Cr 3  63 6C 73             .byte "cls"
002D8Fr 3

003CA3r 3               
003CA3r 3               ; END of EDITOR-WORDLIST
003CA3r 3               
003CA3r 3               
003CA3r 3               ; ; ASSEMBLER-WORDLIST
003CA3r 3               
003CA3r 3               ; ; Labels for the opcodes have the format "nt_asm_<OPC>" where a futher
003CA3r 3               ; ; underscore replaces any dot present in the SAN mnemonic. The hash sign for
003CA3r 3               ; ; immediate addressing is replaced by an "h" (for example, the label code for
003CA3r 3               ; ; "lda.#" is "xt_adm_lda_h"). All opcodes are immediate.
003CA3r 3               .ifdef TALI_OPTIONAL_ASSEMBLER
003CA3r 3               assembler_dictionary_start:
003CA3r 3               nt_asm_adc_h:
003CA3r 3  05 04        		.byte 5, IM
003CA5r 3  rr rr                        .word nt_asm_adc_x

004560r 3               
004560r 3               ; Assembler pseudo-instructions, directives and macros
004560r 3               
004560r 3               nt_asm_arrow:   ; uses same code as HERE, but immediate
004560r 3  03 04                        .byte 3, IM
004562r 3  rr rr                        .word nt_asm_back_jump
004564r 3  rr rr rr rr                  .word xt_asm_arrow, z_asm_arrow
004568r 3  2D 2D 3E                     .byte "-->"
00456Br 3               
00456Br 3               
00456Br 3               nt_asm_back_jump:  ; syntactic sugar, does nothing
00456Br 3  02 04                        .byte 2, IM
00456Dr 3  rr rr                        .word nt_asm_back_branch
00456Fr 3  rr rr rr rr                  .word xt_asm_back_jump, z_asm_back_jump
004573r 3  3C 6A                        .byte "<j"
004575r 3               
004575r 3               nt_asm_back_branch:
004575r 3  02 04                        .byte 2, IM
004577r 3  rr rr                        .word nt_asm_push_a
004579r 3  rr rr rr rr                  .word xt_asm_back_branch, z_asm_back_branch
00457Dr 3  3C 62                        .byte "<b"
00457Fr 3               
00457Fr 3               nt_asm_push_a:
00457Fr 3  06 04                        .byte 6, IM
004581r 3  00 00                        .word 0000
004583r 3  rr rr rr rr                  .word xt_asm_push_a, z_asm_push_a
004587r 3  70 75 73 68                  .byte "push-a"
00458Br 3  2D 61        
00458Dr 3               
00458Dr 3               .endif
00458Dr 3               
00458Dr 3               ; END of ASSEMBLER-WORDLIST
00458Dr 3               
00458Dr 3               ; END
00458Dr 3               
00458Dr 2                   .include "strings.s"          ; Headers of native words
00458Dr 3               ; List of Strings for Tali Forth 2
00458Dr 3               ; Scot W. Stevenson <scot.stevenson@gmail.com>
00458Dr 3               ; First version: 01. Apr 2016 (for Liara Forth)
00458Dr 3               ; This version: 28. Dec 2018
00458Dr 3               
00458Dr 3               ; This file is included by taliforth.asm
00458Dr 3               
00458Dr 3               ; ## GENERAL STRINGS
00458Dr 3               
00458Dr 3               ; All general strings must be zero-terminated, names start with "s_",
00458Dr 3               ; aliases with "str_"
00458Dr 3               
00458Dr 3               str_ok =              0
00458Dr 3               str_compile =         1
00458Dr 3               str_redefined =       2
00458Dr 3               str_wid_forth =       3
00458Dr 3               str_abc_lower =       4
00458Dr 3               str_abc_upper =       5
00458Dr 3               str_wid_editor =      6
00458Dr 3               str_wid_assembler =   7
00458Dr 3               str_wid_root =        8
00458Dr 3               str_see_flags =       9
00458Dr 3               str_see_nt =         10
00458Dr 3               str_see_xt =         11
00458Dr 3               str_see_size =       12
00458Dr 3               str_disasm_lit     = 13
00458Dr 3               str_disasm_sdc     = 14
00458Dr 3               str_disasm_bra     = 15
00458Dr 3               
00458Dr 3               ; Since we can't fit a 16-bit address in a register, we use indexes as offsets
00458Dr 3               ; to tables as error and string numbers.
00458Dr 3               string_table:
00458Dr 3  rr rr rr rr          .word s_ok, s_compiled, s_redefined, s_wid_forth, s_abc_lower ; 0-4
004591r 3  rr rr rr rr  
004595r 3  rr rr        
004597r 3  rr rr rr rr          .word s_abc_upper, s_wid_editor, s_wid_asm, s_wid_root        ; 5-8
00459Br 3  rr rr rr rr  
00459Fr 3  rr rr rr rr          .word s_see_flags, s_see_nt, s_see_xt, s_see_size             ; 9-12
0045A3r 3  rr rr rr rr  
0045A7r 3               
0045A7r 3  20 6F 6B 00  s_ok:         .byte " ok", 0         ; note space at beginning
0045ABr 3  20 63 6F 6D  s_compiled:   .byte " compiled", 0   ; note space at beginning
0045AFr 3  70 69 6C 65  
0045B3r 3  64 00        
0045B5r 3  72 65 64 65  s_redefined:  .byte "redefined ", 0  ; note space at end
0045B9r 3  66 69 6E 65  
0045BDr 3  64 20 00     
0045C0r 3               
0045C0r 3  30 31 32 33  s_abc_lower:  .byte "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
0045C4r 3  34 35 36 37  
0045C8r 3  38 39 61 62  
0045E4r 3  30 31 32 33  s_abc_upper:  .byte "0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"
0045E8r 3  34 35 36 37  
0045ECr 3  38 39 41 42  
004608r 3               
004608r 3  41 73 73 65  s_wid_asm:    .byte "Assembler ", 0  ; Wordlist ID 2, note space at end
00460Cr 3  6D 62 6C 65  
004610r 3  72 20 00     
004613r 3  45 64 69 74  s_wid_editor: .byte "Editor ", 0     ; Wordlist ID 1, note space at end
004617r 3  6F 72 20 00  
00461Br 3  46 6F 72 74  s_wid_forth:  .byte "Forth ", 0      ; Wordlist ID 0, note space at end
00461Fr 3  68 20 00     
004622r 3  52 6F 6F 74  s_wid_root:   .byte "Root ", 0       ; Wordlist ID 3, note space at end
004626r 3  20 00        
004628r 3               
004628r 3  66 6C 61 67  s_see_flags:  .byte "flags (CO AN IM NN UF HC): ", 0
00462Cr 3  73 20 28 43  
004630r 3  4F 20 41 4E  
004644r 3  6E 74 3A 20  s_see_nt:     .byte "nt: ", 0
004648r 3  00           
004649r 3  78 74 3A 20  s_see_xt:     .byte "xt: ", 0
00464Dr 3  00           
00464Er 3  73 69 7A 65  s_see_size:   .byte "size (decimal): ", 0
004652r 3  20 28 64 65  
004656r 3  63 69 6D 61  
00465Fr 3  4C 49 54 45  s_disasm_lit: .byte "LITERAL ", 0
004663r 3  52 41 4C 20  
004667r 3  00           
004668r 3  53 54 41 43  s_disasm_sdc: .byte "STACK DEPTH CHECK", 0
00466Cr 3  4B 20 44 45  
004670r 3  50 54 48 20  
00467Ar 3  42 52 41 4E  s_disasm_bra: .byte "BRANCH ",0
00467Er 3  43 48 20 00  
004682r 3               
004682r 3               
004682r 3               ; ## ERROR STRINGS
004682r 3               
004682r 3               ; All error strings must be zero-terminated, all names start with "es_",
004682r 3               ; aliases with "err_". If the string texts are changed, the test suite must be
004682r 3               ; as well
004682r 3               
004682r 3               err_allot =        0
004682r 3               err_badsource =    1
004682r 3               err_compileonly =  2
004682r 3               err_defer =        3
004682r 3               err_divzero =      4
004682r 3               err_noname =       5
004682r 3               err_refill =       6
004682r 3               err_state =        7
004682r 3               err_syntax =       8
004682r 3               err_underflow =    9
004682r 3               err_negallot =     10
004682r 3               err_wordlist =     11
004682r 3               err_blockwords =   12
004682r 3               err_ramexp =      13
004682r 3               
004682r 3               error_table:
004682r 3  rr rr rr rr          .word es_allot, es_badsource, es_compileonly, es_defer  ;  0-3
004686r 3  rr rr rr rr  
00468Ar 3  rr rr rr rr          .word es_divzero, es_noname, es_refill, es_state        ;  4-7
00468Er 3  rr rr rr rr  
004692r 3  rr rr rr rr          .word es_syntax, es_underflow, es_negallot, es_wordlist ;  8-11
004696r 3  rr rr rr rr  
00469Ar 3  rr rr rr rr          .word es_blockwords, es_ramexp                                    ; 12-13
00469Er 3               
00469Er 3  41 4C 4C 4F  es_allot:       .byte "ALLOT using all available memory", 0
0046A2r 3  54 20 75 73  
0046A6r 3  69 6E 67 20  
0046BFr 3  49 6C 6C 65  es_badsource:   .byte "Illegal SOURCE-ID during REFILL", 0
0046C3r 3  67 61 6C 20  
0046C7r 3  53 4F 55 52  
0046DFr 3  49 6E 74 65  es_compileonly: .byte "Interpreting a compile-only word", 0
0046E3r 3  72 70 72 65  
0046E7r 3  74 69 6E 67  
004700r 3  44 45 46 45  es_defer:       .byte "DEFERed word not defined yet", 0
004704r 3  52 65 64 20  
004708r 3  77 6F 72 64  
00471Dr 3  44 69 76 69  es_divzero:     .byte "Division by zero", 0
004721r 3  73 69 6F 6E  
004725r 3  20 62 79 20  
00472Er 3  50 61 72 73  es_noname:      .byte "Parsing failure", 0
004732r 3  69 6E 67 20  
004736r 3  66 61 69 6C  
00473Er 3  51 55 49 54  es_refill:      .byte "QUIT could not get input (REFILL returned -1)", 0
004742r 3  20 63 6F 75  
004746r 3  6C 64 20 6E  
00476Cr 3  41 6C 72 65  es_state:       .byte "Already in compile mode", 0
004770r 3  61 64 79 20  
004774r 3  69 6E 20 63  
004784r 3  55 6E 64 65  es_syntax:      .byte "Undefined word", 0
004788r 3  66 69 6E 65  
00478Cr 3  64 20 77 6F  
004793r 3  53 74 61 63  es_underflow:   .byte "Stack underflow", 0
004797r 3  6B 20 75 6E  
00479Br 3  64 65 72 66  
0047A3r 3  4D 61 78 20  es_negallot:    .byte "Max memory freed with ALLOT", 0
0047A7r 3  6D 65 6D 6F  
0047ABr 3  72 79 20 66  
0047BFr 3  4E 6F 20 77  es_wordlist:    .byte "No wordlists available", 0
0047C3r 3  6F 72 64 6C  
0047C7r 3  69 73 74 73  
0047D6r 3  50 6C 65 61  es_blockwords:  .byte "Please assign vectors BLOCK-READ-VECTOR and BLOCK-WRITE-VECTOR",0
0047DAr 3  73 65 20 61  
0047DEr 3  73 73 69 67  
004815r 3  50 6C 65 61  es_ramexp:      .byte "Please the RAM expansion card address with expad",0
004819r 3  73 65 20 74  
00481Dr 3  68 65 20 52  
004846r 3               ; ## ENVIRONMENT STRINGS
004846r 3               
004846r 3               ; These are used by the ENVIRONMENT? word and stored in the old string format:
004846r 3               ; Length byte first, then the string itself that is not rpt. not
004846r 3               ; zero-terminated. Note these are uppercase by ANS defintion. All start with
004846r 3               ; "envs_".
004846r 3               
004846r 3               ; These return a single-cell number
004846r 3  0F 2F 43 4F  envs_cs:        .byte 15, "/COUNTED-STRING"
00484Ar 3  55 4E 54 45  
00484Er 3  44 2D 53 54  
004856r 3  05 2F 48 4F  envs_hold:      .byte 5, "/HOLD"
00485Ar 3  4C 44        
00485Cr 3  04 2F 50 41  envs_pad:       .byte 4, "/PAD"
004860r 3  44           
004861r 3  11 41 44 44  envs_aub:       .byte 17, "ADDRESS-UNIT-BITS"
004865r 3  52 45 53 53  
004869r 3  2D 55 4E 49  
004873r 3  07 46 4C 4F  envs_floored:   .byte 7, "FLOORED"
004877r 3  4F 52 45 44  
00487Br 3  08 4D 41 58  envs_max_char:  .byte 8, "MAX-CHAR"
00487Fr 3  2D 43 48 41  
004883r 3  52           
004884r 3  05 4D 41 58  envs_max_n:     .byte 5, "MAX-N"
004888r 3  2D 4E        
00488Ar 3  05 4D 41 58  envs_max_u:     .byte 5, "MAX-U"
00488Er 3  2D 55        
004890r 3  12 52 45 54  envs_rsc:       .byte 18, "RETURN-STACK-CELLS"
004894r 3  55 52 4E 2D  
004898r 3  53 54 41 43  
0048A3r 3  0B 53 54 41  envs_sc:        .byte 11, "STACK-CELLS"
0048A7r 3  43 4B 2D 43  
0048ABr 3  45 4C 4C 53  
0048AFr 3  09 57 4F 52  envs_wl:        .byte 9, "WORDLISTS"
0048B3r 3  44 4C 49 53  
0048B7r 3  54 53        
0048B9r 3               
0048B9r 3               ; These return a double-cell number
0048B9r 3  05 4D 41 58  envs_max_d:     .byte 5, "MAX-D"
0048BDr 3  2D 44        
0048BFr 3  06 4D 41 58  envs_max_ud:    .byte 6, "MAX-UD"
0048C3r 3  2D 55 44     
0048C6r 3               
0048C6r 3               ; END
0048C6r 3               
0048C6r 2               
0048C6r 2               ; High-level Forth words, see forth_code/README.md
0048C6r 2               forth_words_start:
0048C6r 2  20 63 72 20  .incbin "forth_code/forth_words.asc"
0048CAr 2  2E 28 20 52  
0048CEr 2  65 61 64 79  
0048D8r 2               forth_words_end:
0048D8r 2               
0048D8r 2               ; User-defined Forth words, see forth_code/README.md
0048D8r 2               user_words_start:
0048D8r 2  20 32 30 20  .incbin "forth_code/user_words.asc"
0048DCr 2  63 6F 6E 73  
0048E0r 2  74 61 6E 74  
004F76r 2               user_words_end:
004F76r 2               
004F76r 2               
004F76r 2               ; =====================================================================
004F76r 2               ; COMPILE WORDS, JUMPS and SUBROUTINE JUMPS INTO CODE
004F76r 2               
004F76r 2               ; These three routines compile instructions such as "jsr xt_words" into a word
004F76r 2               ; at compile time so they are available at run time. Words that use this
004F76r 2               ; routine may not be natively compiled. We use "cmpl" as not to confuse these
004F76r 2               ; routines with the COMPILE, word. Always call this with a subroutine jump.
004F76r 2               ; This means combining JSR/RTS to JMP in those cases is not going to work. To
004F76r 2               ; use, load the LSB of the address in A and the MSB in Y. You can remember
004F76r 2               ; which comes first by thinking of the song "Young Americans" ("YA") by David
004F76r 2               ; Bowie.
004F76r 2               
004F76r 2               ;               ldy #>addr      ; MSB   ; "Young"
004F76r 2               ;               lda #<addr      ; LSB   ; "Americans"
004F76r 2               ;               jsr cmpl_subroutine
004F76r 2               
004F76r 2               ; Also, we keep a routine here to compile a single byte passed through A.
004F76r 2               
004F76r 2               cmpl_subroutine:
004F76r 2                   ; This is the entry point to compile JSR <ADDR>
004F76r 2  48               pha             ; save LSB of address
004F77r 2  A9 20            lda #$20        ; load opcode for JSR
004F79r 2  80 03            bra cmpl_common
004F7Br 2               cmpl_jump:
004F7Br 2                   ; This is the entry point to compile JMP <ADDR>
004F7Br 2  48               pha             ; save LSB of address
004F7Cr 2  A9 4C            lda #$4c        ; load opcode for JMP, fall thru to cmpl_common
004F7Er 2               cmpl_common:
004F7Er 2                   ; At this point, A contains the opcode to be compiled,
004F7Er 2                   ; the LSB of the address is on the 65c02 stack, and the MSB of
004F7Er 2                   ; the address is in Y
004F7Er 2  20 rr rr         jsr cmpl_a      ; compile opcode
004F81r 2  68               pla             ; retrieve address LSB; fall thru to cmpl_word
004F82r 2               cmpl_word:
004F82r 2                   ; This is the entry point to compile a word (little-endian)
004F82r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cmpl_a      ; compile LSB of address
004F85r 2  98               tya             ; fall thru for MSB
004F86r 2               cmpl_a:
004F86r 2                   ; This is the entry point to compile a single byte which
004F86r 2                   ; is passed in A. The built-in assembler assumes that this
004F86r 2                   ; routine does not modify Y.
004F86r 2  92 rr            sta (cp)
004F88r 2  E6 rr            inc cp
004F8Ar 2  D0 02            bne _done
004F8Cr 2  E6 rr            inc cp+1
004F8Er 2               _done:
004F8Er 2  60               rts
004F8Fr 2               
004F8Fr 2               
004F8Fr 2               
004F8Fr 2               ; =====================================================================
004F8Fr 2               ; CODE FIELD ROUTINES
004F8Fr 2               
004F8Fr 2               doconst:
004F8Fr 2               ; """Execute a CONSTANT: Push the data in the first two bytes of
004F8Fr 2               ; the Data Field onto the Data Stack
004F8Fr 2               ; """
004F8Fr 2  CA               dex             ; make room for constant
004F90r 2  CA               dex
004F91r 2               
004F91r 2                   ; The value we need is stored in the two bytes after the
004F91r 2                   ; JSR return address, which in turn is what is on top of
004F91r 2                   ; the Return Stack
004F91r 2  68               pla             ; LSB of return address
004F92r 2  85 rr            sta tmp1
004F94r 2  68               pla             ; MSB of return address
004F95r 2  85 rr            sta tmp1+1
004F97r 2               
004F97r 2                   ; Start LDY with 1 instead of 0 because of how JSR stores
004F97r 2                   ; the return address on the 65c02
004F97r 2  A0 01            ldy #1
004F99r 2  B1 rr            lda (tmp1),y
004F9Br 2  95 00            sta 0,x
004F9Dr 2  C8               iny
004F9Er 2  B1 rr            lda (tmp1),y
004FA0r 2  95 01            sta 1,x
004FA2r 2               
004FA2r 2                   ; This takes us back to the original caller, not the
004FA2r 2                   ; DOCONST caller
004FA2r 2  60               rts
004FA3r 2               
004FA3r 2               
004FA3r 2               dodefer:
004FA3r 2               ; """Execute a DEFER statement at runtime: Execute the address we
004FA3r 2               ; find after the caller in the Data Field
004FA3r 2               ; """
004FA3r 2                   ; The xt we need is stored in the two bytes after the JSR
004FA3r 2                   ; return address, which is what is on top of the Return
004FA3r 2                   ; Stack. So all we have to do is replace our return jump
004FA3r 2                   ; with what we find there
004FA3r 2  68               pla             ; LSB
004FA4r 2  85 rr            sta tmp1
004FA6r 2  68               pla             ; MSB
004FA7r 2  85 rr            sta tmp1+1
004FA9r 2               
004FA9r 2  A0 01            ldy #1
004FABr 2  B1 rr            lda (tmp1),y
004FADr 2  85 rr            sta tmp2
004FAFr 2  C8               iny
004FB0r 2  B1 rr            lda (tmp1),y
004FB2r 2  85 rr            sta tmp2+1
004FB4r 2               
004FB4r 2  6C rr rr         jmp (tmp2)      ; This is actually a jump to the new target
004FB7r 2               
004FB7r 2               defer_error:
004FB7r 2                   ; """Error routine for undefined DEFER: Complain and abort"""
004FB7r 2  A9 03            lda #err_defer
004FB9r 2  4C rr rr         jmp error
004FBCr 2               
004FBCr 2               dodoes:
004FBCr 2               ; """Execute the runtime portion of DOES>. See DOES> and
004FBCr 2               ; docs/create-does.txt for details and
004FBCr 2               ; http://www.bradrodriguez.com/papers/moving3.htm
004FBCr 2               ; """
004FBCr 2                   ; Assumes the address of the CFA of the original defining word
004FBCr 2                   ; (say, CONSTANT) is on the top of the Return Stack. Save it
004FBCr 2                   ; for a later jump, adding one byte because of the way the
004FBCr 2                   ; 6502 works
004FBCr 2  7A               ply             ; LSB
004FBDr 2  68               pla             ; MSB
004FBEr 2  C8               iny
004FBFr 2  D0 01            bne @1
004FC1r 2  1A               inc
004FC2r 2               @1:
004FC2r 2  84 rr            sty tmp2
004FC4r 2  85 rr            sta tmp2+1
004FC6r 2               
004FC6r 2                   ; Next on the Return Stack should be the address of the PFA of
004FC6r 2                   ; the calling defined word (say, the name of whatever constant we
004FC6r 2                   ; just defined). Move this to the Data Stack, again adding one.
004FC6r 2  CA               dex
004FC7r 2  CA               dex
004FC8r 2               
004FC8r 2  7A               ply
004FC9r 2  68               pla
004FCAr 2  C8               iny
004FCBr 2  D0 01            bne @2
004FCDr 2  1A               inc
004FCEr 2               @2:
004FCEr 2  94 00            sty 0,x         ; LSB
004FD0r 2  95 01            sta 1,x         ; MSB
004FD2r 2               
004FD2r 2                   ; This leaves the return address from the original main routine
004FD2r 2                   ; on top of the Return Stack. We leave that untouched and jump
004FD2r 2                   ; to the special code of the defining word. It's RTS instruction
004FD2r 2                   ; will take us back to the main routine
004FD2r 2  6C rr rr         jmp (tmp2)
004FD5r 2               
004FD5r 2               
004FD5r 2               dovar:
004FD5r 2               ; """Execute a variable: Push the address of the first bytes of
004FD5r 2               ; the Data Field onto the stack. This is called with JSR so we
004FD5r 2               ; can pick up the address of the calling variable off the 65c02's
004FD5r 2               ; stack. The final RTS takes us to the original caller of the
004FD5r 2               ; routine that itself called DOVAR. This is the default
004FD5r 2               ; routine installed with CREATE.
004FD5r 2               ; """
004FD5r 2                   ; Pull the return address off the machine's stack, adding
004FD5r 2                   ; one because of the way the 65c02 handles subroutines
004FD5r 2  7A               ply             ; LSB
004FD6r 2  68               pla             ; MSB
004FD7r 2  C8               iny
004FD8r 2  D0 01            bne @1
004FDAr 2  1A               inc
004FDBr 2               @1:
004FDBr 2  CA               dex
004FDCr 2  CA               dex
004FDDr 2               
004FDDr 2  95 01            sta 1,x
004FDFr 2  98               tya
004FE0r 2  95 00            sta 0,x
004FE2r 2               
004FE2r 2  60               rts
004FE3r 2               
004FE3r 2               ; =====================================================================
004FE3r 2               ; LOW LEVEL HELPER FUNCTIONS
004FE3r 2               
004FE3r 2               byte_to_ascii:
004FE3r 2               ; """Convert byte in A to two ASCII hex digits and EMIT them"""
004FE3r 2               .scope
004FE3r 2  48               pha
004FE4r 2  4A               lsr             ; convert high nibble first
004FE5r 2  4A               lsr
004FE6r 2  4A               lsr
004FE7r 2  4A               lsr
004FE8r 2  20 rr rr         jsr _nibble_to_ascii
004FEBr 2  68               pla
004FECr 2               
004FECr 2                   ; fall through to _nibble_to_ascii
004FECr 2               
004FECr 2               _nibble_to_ascii:
004FECr 2               ; """Private helper function for byte_to_ascii: Print lower nibble
004FECr 2               ; of A and and EMIT it. This does the actual work.
004FECr 2               ; """
004FECr 2  29 0F            and #$0F
004FEEr 2  09 30            ora #'0'
004FF0r 2  C9 3A            cmp #$3A        ; '9+1
004FF2r 2  90 02            bcc @1
004FF4r 2  69 06            adc #$06
004FF6r 2               
004FF6r 2  4C rr rr     @1:               jmp emit_a
004FF9r 2               
004FF9r 2  60               rts
004FFAr 2               .endscope
004FFAr 2               
004FFAr 2               compare_16bit:
004FFAr 2               ; """Compare TOS/NOS and return results in form of the 65c02 flags
004FFAr 2               ; Adapted from Leventhal "6502 Assembly Language Subroutines", see
004FFAr 2               ; also http://www.6502.org/tutorials/compare_beyond.html
004FFAr 2               ; For signed numbers, Z signals equality and N which number is larger:
004FFAr 2               ;       if TOS = NOS: Z=1 and N=0
004FFAr 2               ;       if TOS > NOS: Z=0 and N=0
004FFAr 2               ;       if TOS < NOS: Z=0 and N=1
004FFAr 2               ; For unsigned numbers, Z signals equality and C which number is larger:
004FFAr 2               ;       if TOS = NOS: Z=1 and N=0
004FFAr 2               ;       if TOS > NOS: Z=0 and C=1
004FFAr 2               ;       if TOS < NOS: Z=0 and C=0
004FFAr 2               ; Compared to the book routine, WORD1 (MINUED) is TOS
004FFAr 2               ;                               WORD2 (SUBTRAHEND) is NOS
004FFAr 2               ; """
004FFAr 2               .scope
004FFAr 2                   ; Compare LSB first to set the carry flag
004FFAr 2  B5 00            lda 0,x                 ; LSB of TOS
004FFCr 2  D5 02            cmp 2,x                 ; LSB of NOS
004FFEr 2  F0 0A            beq _equal
005000r 2               
005000r 2                   ; LSBs are not equal, compare MSB
005000r 2  B5 01            lda 1,x                 ; MSB of TOS
005002r 2  F5 03            sbc 3,x                 ; MSB of NOS
005004r 2  09 01            ora #1                  ; Make zero flag 0 because not equal
005006r 2  70 08            bvs _overflow
005008r 2  80 08            bra _not_equal
00500Ar 2               _equal:
00500Ar 2                   ; Low bytes are equal, so we compare high bytes
00500Ar 2  B5 01            lda 1,x                 ; MSB of TOS
00500Cr 2  F5 03            sbc 3,x                 ; MSB of NOS
00500Er 2  50 04            bvc _done
005010r 2               _overflow:
005010r 2                   ; Handle overflow because we use signed numbers
005010r 2  49 80            eor #$80                ; complement negative flag
005012r 2               _not_equal:
005012r 2  09 01            ora #1                  ; if overflow, we can't be eqal
005014r 2               _done:
005014r 2  60               rts
005015r 2               .endscope
005015r 2               
005015r 2               current_to_dp:
005015r 2               ; """Look up the current (compilation) dictionary pointer
005015r 2               ; in the wordlist set and put it into the dp zero-page
005015r 2               ; variable. Uses A and Y.
005015r 2               ; """
005015r 2                   ; Determine which wordlist is current
005015r 2  A0 04            ldy #current_offset
005017r 2  B1 rr            lda (up),y      ; current is a byte variable
005019r 2  0A               asl             ; turn it into an offset (in cells)
00501Ar 2               
00501Ar 2                   ; Get the dictionary pointer for that wordlist.
00501Ar 2  18               clc
00501Br 2  69 06            adc #wordlists_offset   ; add offset to wordlists base.
00501Dr 2  A8               tay
00501Er 2  B1 rr            lda (up),y              ; get the dp for that wordlist.
005020r 2  85 rr            sta dp
005022r 2  C8               iny
005023r 2  B1 rr            lda (up),y
005025r 2  85 rr            sta dp+1
005027r 2               
005027r 2  60               rts
005028r 2               
005028r 2               
005028r 2               dp_to_current:
005028r 2               ; """Look up which wordlist is current and update its pointer
005028r 2               ; with the value in dp. Uses A and Y.
005028r 2               ; """
005028r 2                   ; Determine which wordlist is current
005028r 2  A0 04            ldy #current_offset
00502Ar 2  B1 rr            lda (up),y      ; current is a byte variable
00502Cr 2  0A               asl             ; turn it into an offset (in cells)
00502Dr 2               
00502Dr 2                   ; Get the dictionary pointer for that wordlist.
00502Dr 2  18               clc
00502Er 2  69 06            adc #wordlists_offset   ; add offset to wordlists base.
005030r 2  A8               tay
005031r 2  A5 rr            lda dp
005033r 2  91 rr            sta (up),y              ; get the dp for that wordlist.
005035r 2  C8               iny
005036r 2  A5 rr            lda dp+1
005038r 2  91 rr            sta (up),y
00503Ar 2               
00503Ar 2  60               rts
00503Br 2               
00503Br 2               interpret:
00503Br 2               .scope
00503Br 2               ; """Core routine for the interpreter called by EVALUATE and QUIT.
00503Br 2               ; Process one line only. Assumes that the address of name is in
00503Br 2               ; cib and the length of the whole input line string is in ciblen
00503Br 2               ; """
00503Br 2                   ; Normally we would use PARSE here with the SPACE character as
00503Br 2                   ; a parameter (PARSE replaces WORD in modern Forths). However,
00503Br 2                   ; Gforth's PARSE-NAME makes more sense as it uses spaces as
00503Br 2                   ; delimiters per default and skips any leading spaces, which
00503Br 2                   ; PARSE doesn't
00503Br 2               _loop:
00503Br 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_parse_name       ; ( "string" -- addr u )
00503Er 2               
00503Er 2                   ; If PARSE-NAME returns 0 (empty line), no characters were left
00503Er 2                   ; in the line and we need to go get a new line
00503Er 2  B5 00            lda 0,x
005040r 2  15 01            ora 1,x
005042r 2  F0 70            beq _line_done
005044r 2               
005044r 2                   ; Go to FIND-NAME to see if this is a word we know. We have to
005044r 2                   ; make a copy of the address in case it isn't a word we know and
005044r 2                   ; we have to go see if it is a number
005044r 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_two_dup          ; ( addr u -- addr u addr u )
005047r 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_find_name        ; ( addr u addr u -- addr u nt|0 )
00504Ar 2               
00504Ar 2                   ; A zero signals that we didn't find a word in the Dictionary
00504Ar 2  B5 00            lda 0,x
00504Cr 2  15 01            ora 1,x
00504Er 2  D0 28            bne _got_name_token
005050r 2               
005050r 2                   ; We didn't get any nt we know of, so let's see if this is
005050r 2                   ; a number.
005050r 2  E8               inx                     ; ( addr u 0 -- addr u )
005051r 2  E8               inx
005052r 2               
005052r 2                   ; If the number conversion doesn't work, NUMBER will do the
005052r 2                   ; complaining for us
005052r 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_number           ; ( addr u -- u|d )
005055r 2               
005055r 2                   ; Otherweise, if we're interpreting, we're done
005055r 2  A5 rr            lda state
005057r 2  F0 E2            beq _loop
005059r 2               
005059r 2                   ; We're compiling, so there is a bit more work.  Check
005059r 2                   ; status bit 5 to see if it's a single or double-cell
005059r 2                   ; number.
005059r 2  A9 20            lda #$20
00505Br 2  24 rr            bit status
00505Dr 2  F0 0D            beq _single_number
00505Fr 2               
00505Fr 2                   ; It's a double cell number.  If we swap the
00505Fr 2                   ; upper and lower half, we can use the literal_runtime twice
00505Fr 2                   ; to compile it into the dictionary.
00505Fr 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_swap
005062r 2  A0 rr            ldy #>literal_runtime
005064r 2  A9 rr            lda #<literal_runtime
005066r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cmpl_subroutine
005069r 2               
005069r 2                   ; compile our number
005069r 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_comma
00506Cr 2               
00506Cr 2                   ; Fall into _single_number to process the other half.
00506Cr 2               _single_number:
00506Cr 2  A0 rr            ldy #>literal_runtime
00506Er 2  A9 rr            lda #<literal_runtime
005070r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cmpl_subroutine
005073r 2               
005073r 2                   ; compile our number
005073r 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_comma
005076r 2               
005076r 2                   ; That was so much fun, let's do it again!
005076r 2  80 C3            bra _loop
005078r 2               
005078r 2               _got_name_token:
005078r 2                   ; We have a known word's nt TOS. We're going to need its xt
005078r 2                   ; though, which is four bytes father down.
005078r 2               
005078r 2                   ; We arrive here with ( addr u nt ), so we NIP twice
005078r 2  B5 00            lda 0,x
00507Ar 2  95 04            sta 4,x
00507Cr 2  B5 01            lda 1,x
00507Er 2  95 05            sta 5,x
005080r 2               
005080r 2  E8               inx
005081r 2  E8               inx
005082r 2  E8               inx
005083r 2  E8               inx                     ; ( nt )
005084r 2               
005084r 2                   ; Save a version of nt for error handling and compilation stuff
005084r 2  B5 00            lda 0,x
005086r 2  85 rr            sta tmpbranch
005088r 2  B5 01            lda 1,x
00508Ar 2  85 rr            sta tmpbranch+1
00508Cr 2               
00508Cr 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_name_to_int      ; ( nt - xt )
00508Fr 2               
00508Fr 2                   ; See if we are in interpret or compile mode, 0 is interpret
00508Fr 2  A5 rr            lda state
005091r 2  D0 13            bne _compile
005093r 2               
005093r 2                   ; We are interpreting, so EXECUTE the xt that is TOS. First,
005093r 2                   ; though, see if this isn't a compile-only word, which would be
005093r 2                   ; illegal. The status byte is the second one of the header.
005093r 2  A0 01            ldy #1
005095r 2  B1 rr            lda (tmpbranch),y
005097r 2  29 01            and #CO                 ; mask everything but Compile Only bit
005099r 2  F0 05            beq _interpret
00509Br 2               
00509Br 2  A9 02            lda #err_compileonly
00509Dr 2  4C rr rr         jmp error
0050A0r 2               
0050A0r 2               _interpret:
0050A0r 2                   ; We JSR to EXECUTE instead of calling the xt directly because
0050A0r 2                   ; the RTS of the word we're executing will bring us back here,
0050A0r 2                   ; skipping EXECUTE completely during RTS. If we were to execute
0050A0r 2                   ; xt directly, we have to fool around with the Return Stack
0050A0r 2                   ; instead, which is actually slightly slower
0050A0r 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_execute
0050A3r 2               
0050A3r 2                   ; That's quite enough for this word, let's get the next one
0050A3r 2  4C rr rr         jmp _loop
0050A6r 2               
0050A6r 2               _compile:
0050A6r 2                   ; We're compiling! However, we need to see if this is an
0050A6r 2                   ; IMMEDIATE word, which would mean we execute it right now even
0050A6r 2                   ; during compilation mode. Fortunately, we saved the nt so life
0050A6r 2                   ; is easier. The flags are in the second byte of the header
0050A6r 2  A0 01            ldy #1
0050A8r 2  B1 rr            lda (tmpbranch),y
0050AAr 2  29 04            and #IM                 ; Mask all but IM bit
0050ACr 2  D0 F2            bne _interpret          ; IMMEDIATE word, execute right now
0050AEr 2               
0050AEr 2                   ; Compile the xt into the Dictionary with COMPILE,
0050AEr 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_compile_comma
0050B1r 2  4C rr rr         jmp _loop
0050B4r 2               
0050B4r 2               _line_done:
0050B4r 2                   ; drop stuff from PARSE_NAME
0050B4r 2  E8               inx
0050B5r 2  E8               inx
0050B6r 2  E8               inx
0050B7r 2  E8               inx
0050B8r 2               
0050B8r 2  60               rts
0050B9r 2               .endscope
0050B9r 2               
0050B9r 2               
0050B9r 2               is_printable:
0050B9r 2               .scope
0050B9r 2               ; """Given a character in A, check if it is a printable ASCII
0050B9r 2               ; character in the range from $20 to $7E inclusive. Returns the
0050B9r 2               ; result in the Carry Flag: 0 (clear) is not printable, 1 (set)
0050B9r 2               ; is printable. Keeps A. See
0050B9r 2               ; http://www.obelisk.me.uk/6502/algorithms.html for a
0050B9r 2               ; discussion of various ways to do this
0050B9r 2  C9 20            cmp #AscSP              ; $20
0050BBr 2  90 08            bcc _done
0050BDr 2  C9 7F            cmp #'~' + 1             ; $7E
0050BFr 2  B0 03            bcs _failed
0050C1r 2               
0050C1r 2  38               sec
0050C2r 2  80 01            bra _done
0050C4r 2               _failed:
0050C4r 2  18               clc
0050C5r 2               _done:
0050C5r 2  60               rts
0050C6r 2               .endscope
0050C6r 2               
0050C6r 2               
0050C6r 2               is_whitespace:
0050C6r 2               .scope
0050C6r 2               ; """Given a character in A, check if it is a whitespace
0050C6r 2               ; character, that is, an ASCII value from 0 to 32 (where
0050C6r 2               ; 32 is SPACE). Returns the result in the Carry Flag:
0050C6r 2               ; 0 (clear) is no, it isn't whitespace, while 1 (set) means
0050C6r 2               ; that it is whitespace. See PARSE and PARSE-NAME for
0050C6r 2               ; a discussion of the uses. Does not change A or Y.
0050C6r 2  C9 00            cmp #00         ; explicit comparison to leave Y untouched
0050C8r 2  90 08            bcc _done
0050CAr 2               
0050CAr 2  C9 21            cmp #AscSP+1
0050CCr 2  B0 03            bcs _failed
0050CEr 2               
0050CEr 2  38               sec
0050CFr 2  80 01            bra _done
0050D1r 2               _failed:
0050D1r 2  18               clc
0050D2r 2               _done:
0050D2r 2  60               rts
0050D3r 2               .endscope
0050D3r 2               
0050D3r 2               
0050D3r 2               ; Underflow tests. We jump to the label with the number of cells (not: bytes)
0050D3r 2               ; required for the word. This routine flows into the generic error handling
0050D3r 2               ; code
0050D3r 2               underflow_1:
0050D3r 2               ; """Make sure we have at least one cell on the Data Stack"""
0050D3r 2  E0 rr            cpx #dsp0-1
0050D5r 2  10 10            bpl underflow_error
0050D7r 2  60               rts
0050D8r 2               underflow_2:
0050D8r 2               ; """Make sure we have at least two cells on the Data Stack"""
0050D8r 2  E0 rr            cpx #dsp0-3
0050DAr 2  10 0B            bpl underflow_error
0050DCr 2  60               rts
0050DDr 2               underflow_3:
0050DDr 2               ; """Make sure we have at least three cells on the Data Stack"""
0050DDr 2  E0 rr            cpx #dsp0-5
0050DFr 2  10 06            bpl underflow_error
0050E1r 2  60               rts
0050E2r 2               underflow_4:
0050E2r 2               ; """Make sure we have at least four cells on the Data Stack"""
0050E2r 2  E0 rr            cpx #dsp0-7
0050E4r 2  10 01            bpl underflow_error
0050E6r 2  60               rts
0050E7r 2               
0050E7r 2               underflow_error:
0050E7r 2                   ; Entry for COLD/ABORT/QUIT
0050E7r 2  A9 09            lda #err_underflow      ; fall through to error
0050E9r 2               
0050E9r 2               error:
0050E9r 2               ; """Given the error number in a, print the associated error string and
0050E9r 2               ; call abort. Uses tmp3.
0050E9r 2               ; """
0050E9r 2  0A               asl
0050EAr 2  A8               tay
0050EBr 2  B9 rr rr         lda error_table,y
0050EEr 2  85 rr            sta tmp3                ; LSB
0050F0r 2  C8               iny
0050F1r 2  B9 rr rr         lda error_table,y
0050F4r 2  85 rr            sta tmp3+1              ; MSB
0050F6r 2               
0050F6r 2  20 rr rr         jsr print_common
0050F9r 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_cr
0050FCr 2  4C rr rr         jmp xt_abort            ; no jsr, as we clobber return stack
0050FFr 2               
0050FFr 2               
0050FFr 2               ; =====================================================================
0050FFr 2               ; PRINTING ROUTINES
0050FFr 2               
0050FFr 2               ; We distinguish two types of print calls, both of which take the string number
0050FFr 2               ; (see strings.asm) in A:
0050FFr 2               
0050FFr 2               ;       print_string       - with a line feed
0050FFr 2               ;       print_string_no_lf - without a line feed
0050FFr 2               
0050FFr 2               ; In addition, print_common provides a lower-level alternative for error
0050FFr 2               ; handling and anything else that provides the address of the
0050FFr 2               ; zero-terminated string directly in tmp3. All of those routines assume that
0050FFr 2               ; printing should be more concerned with size than speed, because anything to
0050FFr 2               ; do with humans reading text is going to be slow.
0050FFr 2               
0050FFr 2               print_string_no_lf:
0050FFr 2               ; """Given the number of a zero-terminated string in A, print it to the
0050FFr 2               ; current output without adding a LF. Uses Y and tmp3 by falling
0050FFr 2               ; through to print_common
0050FFr 2               ; """
0050FFr 2                   ; Get the entry from the string table
0050FFr 2  0A               asl
005100r 2  A8               tay
005101r 2  B9 rr rr         lda string_table,y
005104r 2  85 rr            sta tmp3                ; LSB
005106r 2  C8               iny
005107r 2  B9 rr rr         lda string_table,y
00510Ar 2  85 rr            sta tmp3+1              ; MSB
00510Cr 2               
00510Cr 2                   ; fall through to print_common
00510Cr 2               print_common:
00510Cr 2               ; """Common print routine used by both the print functions and
00510Cr 2               ; the error printing routine. Assumes string address is in tmp3. Uses
00510Cr 2               ; Y.
00510Cr 2               ; """
00510Cr 2               .scope
00510Cr 2  A0 00            ldy #0
00510Er 2               _loop:
00510Er 2  B1 rr            lda (tmp3),y
005110r 2  F0 06            beq _done               ; strings are zero-terminated
005112r 2               
005112r 2  20 rr rr         jsr emit_a              ; allows vectoring via output
005115r 2  C8               iny
005116r 2  80 F6            bra _loop
005118r 2               _done:
005118r 2  60               rts
005119r 2               .endscope
005119r 2               
005119r 2               print_string:
005119r 2               ; """Print a zero-terminated string to the console/screen, adding a LF.
005119r 2               ; We do not check to see if the index is out of range. Uses tmp3.
005119r 2               ; """
005119r 2  20 rr rr         jsr print_string_no_lf
00511Cr 2  4C rr rr         jmp xt_cr               ; JSR/RTS because never compiled
00511Fr 2               
00511Fr 2               
00511Fr 2               print_u:
00511Fr 2               ; """basic printing routine used by higher-level constructs,
00511Fr 2               ; the equivalent of the forth word  0 <# #s #> type  which is
00511Fr 2               ; basically u. without the space at the end. used for various
00511Fr 2               ; outputs
00511Fr 2               ; """
00511Fr 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_zero                     ; 0
005122r 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_less_number_sign         ; <#
005125r 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_number_sign_s            ; #S
005128r 2  20 rr rr         jsr xt_number_sign_greater      ; #>
00512Br 2  4C rr rr         jmp xt_type                     ; JSR/RTS because never compiled
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ; END
00512Er 2               
00512Er 1               
00512Er 1               .segment "DATA"
00512Er 1               
00512Er 1               .ifdef TALI_OPTIONAL_ASSEMBLER
00512Er 1               .include "../../assembler.s"
00512Er 2               ; Assembler for Tali Forth 2
00512Er 2               ; Scot W. Stevenson <scot.stevenson@gmail.com>
00512Er 2               ; First version: 07. Nov 2014 (as tasm65c02)
00512Er 2               ; This version: 03. Jan 2019
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ; This is the built-in assembler for Tali Forth 2. Once the assembler wordlist
00512Er 2               ; is included with
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ;       assembler-wordlist >order
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ; the opcodes are available as normal Forth words. The format is Simpler
00512Er 2               ; Assembler Notation (SAN) which separates the opcode completely from the
00512Er 2               ; operand (see https://github.com/scotws/SAN). In this case, the operand is
00512Er 2               ; entered before the opcode in the postfix Forth notation (for example, "2000
00512Er 2               ; lda.#"). See the assembler documenation in the manual for more detail.
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ; The code here was originally used in A Typist's Assembler for the 65c02
00512Er 2               ; (tasm65c02), see https://github.com/scotws/tasm65c02 for the standalone
00512Er 2               ; version. Tasm65c02 is in the public domain.
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ; This code makes use of the opcode tables stored as part of the disassembler.
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ; ==========================================================
00512Er 2               ; MNEMONICS
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ; The assembler instructions are realized as individual Forth words with
00512Er 2               ; entries in the assembler wordlist (see header.asm). We pass the opcode in A.
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ; An alterantive method would have been along the lines of
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ;               jsr asm_common
00512Er 2               ;               .byte $EA
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ; where the asm_common then uses the address on the Return Stack to pick up the
00512Er 2               ; opcode and the length. Though this uses fewer resources, the current version
00512Er 2               ; makes up for this by simplifying the code of asm_common.
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               ; The routines are organized alphabetically by SAN mnemonic, not by opcode. The
00512Er 2               ; SAN and traditional mnemonics are listed after the opcode load instruction.
00512Er 2               ; This list was generated by a Python script in the tools folder, see there for
00512Er 2               ; more detail.
00512Er 2               
00512Er 2               assembler:              ; used to calculate size of assembler code
00512Er 2               .ifdef TALI_OPTIONAL_ASSEMBLER
00512Er 2               xt_asm_adc_h:   ; adc.# \ ADC #nn
00512Er 2  A9 69                        lda #$69
005130r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005133r 2               z_asm_adc_h:
005133r 2               
005133r 2               xt_asm_adc_x:   ; adc.x \ ADC nnnn,X
005133r 2  A9 7D                        lda #$7D
005135r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005138r 2               z_asm_adc_x:
005138r 2               
005138r 2               xt_asm_adc_y:   ; adc.y \ ADC nnnn,Y
005138r 2  A9 79                        lda #$79
00513Ar 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
00513Dr 2               z_asm_adc_y:
00513Dr 2               
00513Dr 2               xt_asm_adc_z:   ; adc.z \ ADC nn
00513Dr 2  A9 65                        lda #$65
00513Fr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005142r 2               z_asm_adc_z:
005142r 2               
005142r 2               xt_asm_adc_zi:  ; adc.zi \ ADC (nn)
005142r 2  A9 72                        lda #$72
005144r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005147r 2               z_asm_adc_zi:
005147r 2               
005147r 2               xt_asm_adc_ziy: ; adc.ziy \ ADC (nn),Y
005147r 2  A9 71                        lda #$71
005149r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
00514Cr 2               z_asm_adc_ziy:
00514Cr 2               
00514Cr 2               xt_asm_adc_zx:  ; adc.zx \ ADC nn,X
00514Cr 2  A9 75                        lda #$75
00514Er 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005151r 2               z_asm_adc_zx:
005151r 2               
005151r 2               xt_asm_adc_zxi: ; adc.zxi \ ADC (nn,X)
005151r 2  A9 61                        lda #$61
005153r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005156r 2               z_asm_adc_zxi:
005156r 2               
005156r 2               xt_asm_and:     ; and. \ AND nnnn
005156r 2  A9 2D                        lda #$2D
005158r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
00515Br 2               z_asm_and:
00515Br 2               
00515Br 2               xt_asm_and_h:   ; and.# \ AND #nn
00515Br 2  A9 29                        lda #$29
00515Dr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005160r 2               z_asm_and_h:
005160r 2               
005160r 2               xt_asm_and_x:   ; and.x \ AND nnnn,X
005160r 2  A9 3D                        lda #$3D
005162r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005165r 2               z_asm_and_x:
005165r 2               
005165r 2               xt_asm_and_y:   ; and.y \ AND nnnn,Y
005165r 2  A9 39                        lda #$39
005167r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
00516Ar 2               z_asm_and_y:
00516Ar 2               
00516Ar 2               xt_asm_and_z:   ; and.z \ AND nn
00516Ar 2  A9 25                        lda #$25
00516Cr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
00516Fr 2               z_asm_and_z:
00516Fr 2               
00516Fr 2               xt_asm_and_zi:  ; and.zi \ AND (nn)
00516Fr 2  A9 32                        lda #$32
005171r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005174r 2               z_asm_and_zi:
005174r 2               
005174r 2               xt_asm_and_ziy: ; and.ziy \ AND (nn),Y
005174r 2  A9 31                        lda #$31
005176r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005179r 2               z_asm_and_ziy:
005179r 2               
005179r 2               xt_asm_and_zx:  ; and.zx \ AND nn,X
005179r 2  A9 35                        lda #$35
00517Br 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
00517Er 2               z_asm_and_zx:
00517Er 2               
00517Er 2               xt_asm_and_zxi: ; and.zxi \ AND (nn,X)
00517Er 2  A9 21                        lda #$21
005180r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005183r 2               z_asm_and_zxi:
005183r 2               
005183r 2               xt_asm_asl:     ; asl \ ASL nnnn
005183r 2  A9 0E                        lda #$0E
005185r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005188r 2               z_asm_asl:
005188r 2               
005188r 2               xt_asm_asl_a:   ; asl.a \ ASL
005188r 2  A9 0A                        lda #$0A
00518Ar 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
00518Dr 2               z_asm_asl_a:
00518Dr 2               
00518Dr 2               xt_asm_asl_x:   ; asl.x \ ASL nnnn,X
00518Dr 2  A9 1E                        lda #$1E
00518Fr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005192r 2               z_asm_asl_x:
005192r 2               
005192r 2               xt_asm_asl_z:   ; asl.z \ ASL nn
005192r 2  A9 06                        lda #$06
005194r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005197r 2               z_asm_asl_z:
005197r 2               
005197r 2               xt_asm_asl_zx:  ; asl.zx \ ASL nn,X
005197r 2  A9 16                        lda #$16
005199r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
00519Cr 2               z_asm_asl_zx:
00519Cr 2               
00519Cr 2               xt_asm_bcc:     ; bcc \ BCC
00519Cr 2  A9 90                        lda #$90
00519Er 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0051A1r 2               z_asm_bcc:
0051A1r 2               
0051A1r 2               xt_asm_bcs:     ; bcs \ BCS
0051A1r 2  A9 B0                        lda #$B0
0051A3r 2  A0 02                        ldy #2
0051A5r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0051A8r 2               z_asm_bcs:
0051A8r 2               
0051A8r 2               xt_asm_beq:     ; beq \ BEQ
0051A8r 2  A9 F0                        lda #$F0
0051AAr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0051ADr 2               z_asm_beq:
0051ADr 2               
0051ADr 2               xt_asm_bit:     ; bit \ BIT nnnn
0051ADr 2  A9 2C                        lda #$2C
0051AFr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0051B2r 2               z_asm_bit:
0051B2r 2               
0051B2r 2               xt_asm_bit_h:   ; bit.# \ BIT #nn
0051B2r 2  A9 89                        lda #$89
0051B4r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0051B7r 2               z_asm_bit_h:
0051B7r 2               
0051B7r 2               xt_asm_bit_x:   ; bit.x \ BIT nnnn,X
0051B7r 2  A9 3C                        lda #$3C
0051B9r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0051BCr 2               z_asm_bit_x:
0051BCr 2               
0051BCr 2               xt_asm_bit_z:   ; bit.z \ BIT nn
