005391r 2  A9 68                        lda #$68
005393r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005396r 2               z_asm_pla:
005396r 2               
005396r 2               xt_asm_plp:     ; plp \ PLP
005396r 2  A9 28                        lda #$28
005398r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
00539Br 2               z_asm_plp:
00539Br 2               
00539Br 2               xt_asm_plx:     ; plx \ PLX
00539Br 2  A9 FA                        lda #$FA
00539Dr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053A0r 2               z_asm_plx:
0053A0r 2               
0053A0r 2               xt_asm_ply:     ; ply \ PLY
0053A0r 2  A9 7A                        lda #$7A
0053A2r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053A5r 2               z_asm_ply:
0053A5r 2               
0053A5r 2               xt_asm_rol:     ; rol \ ROL nnnn
0053A5r 2  A9 2E                        lda #$2E
0053A7r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053AAr 2               z_asm_rol:
0053AAr 2               
0053AAr 2               xt_asm_rol_a:   ; rol.a \ ROL
0053AAr 2  A9 2A                        lda #$2A
0053ACr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053AFr 2               z_asm_rol_a:
0053AFr 2               
0053AFr 2               xt_asm_rol_x:   ; rol.x \ ROL nnnn,X
0053AFr 2  A9 3E                        lda #$3E
0053B1r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053B4r 2               z_asm_rol_x:
0053B4r 2               
0053B4r 2               xt_asm_rol_z:   ; rol.z \ ROL nn
0053B4r 2  A9 26                        lda #$26
0053B6r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053B9r 2               z_asm_rol_z:
0053B9r 2               
0053B9r 2               xt_asm_rol_zx:  ; rol.zx \ ROL nn,X
0053B9r 2  A9 36                        lda #$36
0053BBr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053BEr 2               z_asm_rol_zx:
0053BEr 2               
0053BEr 2               xt_asm_ror:     ; ror \ ROR nnnn
0053BEr 2  A9 6E                        lda #$6E
0053C0r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053C3r 2               z_asm_ror:
0053C3r 2               
0053C3r 2               xt_asm_ror_a:   ; ror.a \ ROR
0053C3r 2  A9 6A                        lda #$6A
0053C5r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053C8r 2               z_asm_ror_a:
0053C8r 2               
0053C8r 2               xt_asm_ror_x:   ; ror.x \ ROR nnnn,X
0053C8r 2  A9 7E                        lda #$7E
0053CAr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053CDr 2               z_asm_ror_x:
0053CDr 2               
0053CDr 2               xt_asm_ror_z:   ; ror.z \ ROR nn
0053CDr 2  A9 66                        lda #$66
0053CFr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053D2r 2               z_asm_ror_z:
0053D2r 2               
0053D2r 2               xt_asm_ror_zx:  ; ror.zx \ ROR nn,X
0053D2r 2  A9 76                        lda #$76
0053D4r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053D7r 2               z_asm_ror_zx:
0053D7r 2               
0053D7r 2               xt_asm_rti:     ; rti \ RTI
0053D7r 2  A9 40                        lda #$40
0053D9r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053DCr 2               z_asm_rti:
0053DCr 2               
0053DCr 2               xt_asm_rts:     ; rts \ RTS
0053DCr 2  A9 60                        lda #$60
0053DEr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053E1r 2               z_asm_rts:
0053E1r 2               
0053E1r 2               xt_asm_sbc:     ; sbc \ SBC nnnn
0053E1r 2  A9 ED                        lda #$ED
0053E3r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053E6r 2               z_asm_sbc:
0053E6r 2               
0053E6r 2               xt_asm_sbc_h:   ; sbc.# \ SBC #nn
0053E6r 2  A9 E9                        lda #$E9
0053E8r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053EBr 2               z_asm_sbc_h:
0053EBr 2               
0053EBr 2               xt_asm_sbc_x:   ; sbc.x \ SBC nnnn,X
0053EBr 2  A9 FD                        lda #$FD
0053EDr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053F0r 2               z_asm_sbc_x:
0053F0r 2               
0053F0r 2               xt_asm_sbc_y:   ; sbc.y \ SBC nnnn,Y
0053F0r 2  A9 F9                        lda #$F9
0053F2r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053F5r 2               z_asm_sbc_y:
0053F5r 2               
0053F5r 2               xt_asm_sbc_z:   ; sbc.z \ SBC nn
0053F5r 2  A9 E5                        lda #$E5
0053F7r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053FAr 2               z_asm_sbc_z:
0053FAr 2               
0053FAr 2               xt_asm_sbc_zi:  ; sbc.zi \ SBC (nn)
0053FAr 2  A9 F2                        lda #$F2
0053FCr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
0053FFr 2               z_asm_sbc_zi:
0053FFr 2               
0053FFr 2               xt_asm_sbc_ziy: ; sbc.ziy \ SBC (nn),Y
0053FFr 2  A9 F1                        lda #$F1
005401r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005404r 2               z_asm_sbc_ziy:
005404r 2               
005404r 2               xt_asm_sbc_zx:  ; sbc.zx \ SBC nn,X
005404r 2  A9 F5                        lda #$F5
005406r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp asm_common
005409r 2               z_asm_sbc_zx:
005409r 2               
005409r 2               xt_asm_sbc_zxi: ; sbc.zxi \ SBC (nn,X)
005409r 2  A9 E1                        lda #$E1
00540Br 2  80 7C                        bra asm_common  ; <-- limit for BRA instead of JMP
00540Dr 2               z_asm_sbc_zxi:
00540Dr 2               
00540Dr 2               xt_asm_sec:     ; sec \ SEC
00540Dr 2  A9 38                        lda #$38
00540Fr 2  80 78                        bra asm_common
005411r 2               z_asm_sec:
005411r 2               
005411r 2               xt_asm_sed:     ; sed \ SED
005411r 2  A9 F8                        lda #$F8
005413r 2  80 74                        bra asm_common
005415r 2               z_asm_sed:
005415r 2               
005415r 2               xt_asm_sei:     ; sei \ SEI
005415r 2  A9 78                        lda #$78
005417r 2  80 70                        bra asm_common
005419r 2               z_asm_sei:
005419r 2               
005419r 2               xt_asm_sta:     ; sta \ STA nnnn
005419r 2  A9 8D                        lda #$8D
00541Br 2  80 6C                        bra asm_common
00541Dr 2               z_asm_sta:
00541Dr 2               
00541Dr 2               xt_asm_sta_x:   ; sta.x \ STA nnnn,X
00541Dr 2  A9 9D                        lda #$9D
00541Fr 2  80 68                        bra asm_common
005421r 2               z_asm_sta_x:
005421r 2               
005421r 2               xt_asm_sta_y:   ; sta.y \ STA nnnn,Y
005421r 2  A9 99                        lda #$99
005423r 2  80 64                        bra asm_common
005425r 2               z_asm_sta_y:
005425r 2               
005425r 2               xt_asm_sta_z:   ; sta.z \ STA nn
005425r 2  A9 85                        lda #$85
005427r 2  80 60                        bra asm_common
005429r 2               z_asm_sta_z:
005429r 2               
005429r 2               xt_asm_sta_zi:  ; sta.zi \ STA (nn)
005429r 2  A9 92                        lda #$92
00542Br 2  80 5C                        bra asm_common
00542Dr 2               z_asm_sta_zi:
00542Dr 2               
00542Dr 2               xt_asm_sta_ziy: ; sta.ziy \ STA (nn),Y
00542Dr 2  A9 91                        lda #$91
00542Fr 2  80 58                        bra asm_common
005431r 2               z_asm_sta_ziy:
005431r 2               
005431r 2               xt_asm_sta_zx:  ; sta.zx \ STA nn,X
005431r 2  A9 95                        lda #$95
005433r 2  80 54                        bra asm_common
005435r 2               z_asm_sta_zx:
005435r 2               
005435r 2               xt_asm_sta_zxi: ; sta.zxi \ STA (nn,X)
005435r 2  A9 81                        lda #$81
005437r 2  80 50                        bra asm_common
005439r 2               z_asm_sta_zxi:
005439r 2               
005439r 2               xt_asm_stx:     ; stx \ STX nnnn
005439r 2  A9 8E                        lda #$8E
00543Br 2  80 4C                        bra asm_common
00543Dr 2               z_asm_stx:
00543Dr 2               
00543Dr 2               xt_asm_stx_z:   ; stx.z \ STX nn
00543Dr 2  A9 86                        lda #$86
00543Fr 2  80 48                        bra asm_common
005441r 2               z_asm_stx_z:
005441r 2               
005441r 2               xt_asm_stx_zy:  ; stx.zy \ STX nn,Y
005441r 2  A9 96                        lda #$96
005443r 2  80 44                        bra asm_common
005445r 2               z_asm_stx_zy:
005445r 2               
005445r 2               xt_asm_sty:     ; sty \ STY nnnn
005445r 2  A9 8C                        lda #$8C
005447r 2  80 40                        bra asm_common
005449r 2               z_asm_sty:
005449r 2               
005449r 2               xt_asm_sty_z:   ; sty.z \ STY nn
005449r 2  A9 84                        lda #$84
00544Br 2  80 3C                        bra asm_common
00544Dr 2               z_asm_sty_z:
00544Dr 2               
00544Dr 2               xt_asm_sty_zx:  ; sty.zx \ STY nn,X
00544Dr 2  A9 94                        lda #$94
00544Fr 2  80 38                        bra asm_common
005451r 2               z_asm_sty_zx:
005451r 2               
005451r 2               xt_asm_stz:     ; stz \ STZ nnnn
005451r 2  A9 9C                        lda #$9C
005453r 2  80 34                        bra asm_common
005455r 2               z_asm_stz:
005455r 2               
005455r 2               xt_asm_stz_x:   ; stz.x \ STZ nnnn,X
005455r 2  A9 9E                        lda #$9E
005457r 2  80 30                        bra asm_common
005459r 2               z_asm_stz_x:
005459r 2               
005459r 2               xt_asm_stz_z:   ; stz.z \ STZ nn
005459r 2  A9 64                        lda #$64
00545Br 2  80 2C                        bra asm_common
00545Dr 2               z_asm_stz_z:
00545Dr 2               
00545Dr 2               xt_asm_stz_zx:  ; stz.zx \ STZ nn,X
00545Dr 2  A9 74                        lda #$74
00545Fr 2  80 28                        bra asm_common
005461r 2               z_asm_stz_zx:
005461r 2               
005461r 2               xt_asm_tax:     ; tax \ TAX
005461r 2  A9 AA                        lda #$AA
005463r 2  80 24                        bra asm_common
005465r 2               z_asm_tax:
005465r 2               
005465r 2               xt_asm_tay:     ; tay \ TAY
005465r 2  A9 A8                        lda #$A8
005467r 2  80 20                        bra asm_common
005469r 2               z_asm_tay:
005469r 2               
005469r 2               xt_asm_trb:     ; trb \ TRB nnnn
005469r 2  A9 1C                        lda #$1C
00546Br 2  80 1C                        bra asm_common
00546Dr 2               z_asm_trb:
00546Dr 2               
00546Dr 2               xt_asm_trb_z:   ; trb.z \ TRB nn
00546Dr 2  A9 14                        lda #$14
00546Fr 2  80 18                        bra asm_common
005471r 2               z_asm_trb_z:
005471r 2               
005471r 2               xt_asm_tsb:     ; tsb \ TSB nnnn
005471r 2  A9 0C                        lda #$0C
005473r 2  80 14                        bra asm_common
005475r 2               z_asm_tsb:
005475r 2               
005475r 2               xt_asm_tsb_z:   ; tsb.z \ TSB nn
005475r 2  A9 04                        lda #$04
005477r 2  80 10                        bra asm_common
005479r 2               z_asm_tsb_z:
005479r 2               
005479r 2               xt_asm_tsx:     ; tsx \ TSX
005479r 2  A9 BA                        lda #$BA
00547Br 2  80 0C                        bra asm_common
00547Dr 2               z_asm_tsx:
00547Dr 2               
00547Dr 2               xt_asm_txa:     ; txa \ TXA
00547Dr 2  A9 8A                        lda #$8A
00547Fr 2  80 08                        bra asm_common
005481r 2               z_asm_txa:
005481r 2               
005481r 2               xt_asm_txs:     ; txs \ TXS
005481r 2  A9 9A                        lda #$9A
005483r 2  80 04                        bra asm_common
005485r 2               z_asm_txs:
005485r 2               
005485r 2               xt_asm_tya:     ; tya \ TYA
005485r 2  A9 98                        lda #$98
005487r 2  80 00                        bra asm_common
005489r 2               z_asm_tya:
005489r 2               
005489r 2               
005489r 2               ; ==========================================================
005489r 2               ; ASSEMBLER HELPER FUNCTIONS
005489r 2               
005489r 2               asm_common:
005489r 2               
005489r 2                       ; """Common routine for all opcodes. We arrive here with the opcode in
005489r 2                       ; A. We do not need to check for the correct values because we are
005489r 2                       ; coming from the assembler Dictionary and trust our external test
005489r 2                       ; suite.
005489r 2                       ; """
005489r 2                               ; Compile opcode. Note cmpl_a does not use Y
005489r 2  A8                           tay
00548Ar 2  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a
00548Dr 2               
00548Dr 2                               ; We get the length of the opcode from the table included in
00548Dr 2                               ; the disassembler. We use the opcode value as the offset in
00548Dr 2                               ; the oc_index_table. We have 256 entries, each two bytes
00548Dr 2                               ; long, so we can't just use an index with Y. We use tmp2 for
00548Dr 2                               ; this.
00548Dr 2  A9 rr                        lda #<oc_index_table
00548Fr 2  85 rr                        sta tmp2
005491r 2  A9 rr                        lda #>oc_index_table
005493r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
005495r 2               
005495r 2  98                           tya             ; retrieve opcode
005496r 2  0A                           asl             ; times two for offset
005497r 2  90 02                        bcc @m
005499r 2  E6 rr                        inc tmp2+1
00549Br 2               @m:
00549Br 2  A8                           tay             ; use Y as the index
00549Cr 2               
00549Cr 2                               ; Get address of the entry in the opcode table. We put it in
00549Cr 2                               ; tmp3 and push a copy of it to the stack to be able to print
00549Cr 2                               ; the opcode later
00549Cr 2  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y    ; LSB
00549Er 2  85 rr                        sta tmp3
0054A0r 2  C8                           iny
0054A1r 2  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y    ; MSB
0054A3r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp3+1
0054A5r 2               
0054A5r 2  B2 rr                        lda (tmp3)      ; get "lengths byte"
0054A7r 2               
0054A7r 2                               ; The length of the instruction is stored in bits 7 and 6.
0054A7r 2                               ; Rotate them through the carry flag and mask the rest
0054A7r 2  2A                           rol
0054A8r 2  2A                           rol
0054A9r 2  2A                           rol             ; Three times because we go through Carry
0054AAr 2  29 03                        and #%00000011
0054ACr 2  A8                           tay
0054ADr 2               
0054ADr 2                               ; One byte means no operand, we're done. Use DEY as CPY #1
0054ADr 2  88                           dey
0054AEr 2  F0 12                        beq @done
0054B0r 2               
0054B0r 2                               ; We have an operand which must be TOS
0054B0r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0054B3r 2               
0054B3r 2                               ; We compile the LSB of TOS as the operand we definitely have
0054B3r 2                               ; before we even test if this is a two- or three-byte
0054B3r 2                               ; instruction. Little endian CPU means we store this byte first
0054B3r 2  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0054B5r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a      ; does not use Y
0054B8r 2               
0054B8r 2                               ; If this is a two-byte instruction, we're done. If we landed
0054B8r 2                               ; here, we've already decremented Y by one, so this is
0054B8r 2                               ; the equivalent to CPY #2
0054B8r 2  88                           dey
0054B9r 2  F0 05                        beq @done_drop
0054BBr 2               
0054BBr 2                               ; This must be a three-byte instruction, get the MSB.
0054BBr 2  B5 01                        lda 1,x
0054BDr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a      ; Fall through to _done_drop
0054C0r 2               
0054C0r 2               @done_drop:
0054C0r 2  E8                           inx
0054C1r 2  E8                           inx             ; Fall through to _done
0054C2r 2               @done:
0054C2r 2  60                           rts             ; Returns to original caller
0054C3r 2               
0054C3r 2               
0054C3r 2               ; ==========================================================
0054C3r 2               ; PSEUDO-INSTRUCTIONS AND MACROS
0054C3r 2               
0054C3r 2               xt_asm_push_a:
0054C3r 2                       ; """push-a puts the content of the 65c02 Accumulator on the Forth
0054C3r 2                       ; data stack as the TOS. This is a convience routine that encodes the
0054C3r 2                       ; instructions  DEX  DEX  STA 0,X  STZ 1,X
0054C3r 2                       ; """
0054C3r 2  A0 00                        ldy #0
0054C5r 2               _loop:
0054C5r 2  B9 rr rr                     lda asm_push_a_data,y
0054C8r 2  C9 FF                        cmp #$FF
0054CAr 2  F0 06                        beq @done
0054CCr 2               
0054CCr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a      ; does not change Y
0054CFr 2  C8                           iny
0054D0r 2  80 F3                        bra _loop
0054D2r 2               @done:
0054D2r 2               z_asm_push_a:
0054D2r 2  60                           rts
0054D3r 2               asm_push_a_data:
0054D3r 2                       ; We can't use 00 as a terminator because STA 0,X assembles to 95 00
0054D3r 2  CA CA 95 00          .byte $CA, $CA, $95, 00, $74, $01
0054D7r 2  74 01        
0054D9r 2  FF                   .byte $FF               ; terminator
0054DAr 2               
0054DAr 2               
0054DAr 2               
0054DAr 2               ; ==========================================================
0054DAr 2               ; DIRECTIVES
0054DAr 2               
0054DAr 2               ; The "<J" directive (back jump) is a dummy instruction (syntactic sugar) to
0054DAr 2               ; make clear that the JMP or JSR instructions are using the address that had
0054DAr 2               ; been placed on the stack by "-->" (the "arrow" directive).
0054DAr 2               xt_asm_back_jump:
0054DAr 2               z_asm_back_jump:
0054DAr 2  60                           rts
0054DBr 2               
0054DBr 2               ; The "<B" directive (back branch) takes an address that was placed on the Data
0054DBr 2               ; Stack by the anonymous label directive "-->" (the "arrow") and the current
0054DBr 2               ; address (via HERE) to calculate a backward branch offset. This is then stored
0054DBr 2               ; by a following branch instruction.
0054DBr 2               xt_asm_back_branch:
0054DBr 2                               ; We arrive here with ( addr-l ) of the label on the stack and
0054DBr 2                               ; then subtract the current address
0054DBr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_here             ; ( addr-l addr-h )
0054DEr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus            ; ( offset )
0054E1r 2               
0054E1r 2                               ; We subtract two more because of the branch instruction itself
0054E1r 2  3A                           dea
0054E2r 2  3A                           dea
0054E3r 2               
0054E3r 2               z_asm_back_branch:
0054E3r 2  60                           rts
0054E4r 2               .endif
0054E4r 2               assembler_end:
0054E4r 2               
0054E4r 2               ; END
0054E4r 2               
0054E4r 1               .include "../../disassembler.s"
0054E4r 2               ; Disassembler for Tali Forth 2
0054E4r 2               ; Scot W. Stevenson <scot.stevenson@gmail.com>
0054E4r 2               ; Updated by Sam Colwell
0054E4r 2               ; First version: 28. Apr 2018
0054E4r 2               ; This version: 31. Dec 2022
0054E4r 2               
0054E4r 2               ; This is the default disassembler for Tali Forth 2. Use by passing
0054E4r 2               ; the address and length of the block of memory to be disassembled:
0054E4r 2               ;
0054E4r 2               ;       disasm ( addr x -- )
0054E4r 2               
0054E4r 2               ; The underflow checking is handled by the word's stub in native_words.asm, see
0054E4r 2               ; there for more information.
0054E4r 2               
0054E4r 2               ; The code is disassembled in Simpler Assembler Notation (SAN), because that
0054E4r 2               ; is, uh, simpler. See the documentation and https://github.com/scotws/SAN for
0054E4r 2               ; more information. Because disassemblers are used interactively with slow
0054E4r 2               ; humans, we don't care that much about speed and put the emphasis at being
0054E4r 2               ; small.
0054E4r 2               
0054E4r 2               ; Uses: tmp3, tmp2, tmp1 (xt_u_dot_r uses xt_type which uses tmp1)
0054E4r 2               ;       scratch (used for handling literals and JSRs)
0054E4r 2               
0054E4r 2               disassembler:
0054E4r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr       ; ( addr u )
0054E7r 2               _byte_loop:
0054E7r 2                               ; Print address at start of the line. Note we use whatever
0054E7r 2                               ; number base the user has
0054E7r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_over     ; ( addr u addr )
0054EAr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_u_dot    ; ( addr u )
0054EDr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
0054F0r 2               
0054F0r 2                               ; We use the opcode value as the offset in the oc_index_table.
0054F0r 2                               ; We have 256 entries, each two bytes long, so we can't just
0054F0r 2                               ; use an index with Y. We use tmp2 for this.
0054F0r 2  A9 rr                        lda #<oc_index_table
0054F2r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp2
0054F4r 2  A9 rr                        lda #>oc_index_table
0054F6r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
0054F8r 2               
0054F8r 2  A1 02                        lda (2,x)       ; get opcode that addr points to
0054FAr 2  85 rr                        sta scratch     ; Save opcode
0054FCr 2               
0054FCr 2  0A                           asl             ; multiply by two for offset
0054FDr 2  90 02                        bcc @ok
0054FFr 2  E6 rr                        inc tmp2+1      ; we're on second page
005501r 2               @ok:
005501r 2  A8                           tay             ; use Y as the index
005502r 2               
005502r 2                               ; Get address of the entry in the opcode table. We put it
005502r 2                               ; in tmp3 and push a copy of it to the stack to be able to
005502r 2                               ; print the opcode later
005502r 2  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y    ; LSB
005504r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp3
005506r 2  48                           pha
005507r 2               
005507r 2  C8                           iny
005508r 2               
005508r 2  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y    ; MSB
00550Ar 2  85 rr                        sta tmp3+1
00550Cr 2  48                           pha
00550Dr 2               
00550Dr 2                               ; The first byte is the "lengths byte" which is coded so
00550Dr 2                               ; that bits 7 to 6 are the length of the instruction (1 to
00550Dr 2                               ; 3 bytes) and 2 to 0 are the length of the mnemonic.
00550Dr 2  B2 rr                        lda (tmp3)
00550Fr 2  A8                           tay                     ; save copy of lengths byte
005510r 2               
005510r 2                               ; Since this is Simpler Assembler Notation (SAN) in a Forth
005510r 2                               ; system, we want to print any operand before we print the
005510r 2                               ; mnemonic ('1000 sta' instead of 'sta 1000'). This allows us
005510r 2                               ; to copy and paste directly from the disassembler to the
005510r 2                               ; assembler.
005510r 2               
005510r 2                               ; What happens next depends on the length of the instruction in
005510r 2                               ; bytes:
005510r 2               
005510r 2                               ;   1 byte:  OPC          -->          OPC  bit sequence: %01
005510r 2                               ;   2 bytes: OPC LSB      -->    0 LSB OPC  bit sequence: %10
005510r 2                               ;   3 bytes: OPC LSB MSB  -->  MSB LSB OPC  bit sequence: %11
005510r 2               
005510r 2                               ; We can distinguish between the first case, where there is
005510r 2                               ; only the mnemonic, and the second and third cases, where we
005510r 2                               ; have an operand. We do this by use of the bit sequence in
005510r 2                               ; bits 7 and 6.
005510r 2  10 3C                        bpl _no_operand         ; bit 7 clear, single-byte instruction
005512r 2               
005512r 2                               ; We have an operand. Prepare the Data Stack
005512r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero             ; ( addr u 0 ) ZERO does not use Y
005515r 2               
005515r 2                               ; Because of the glory of a little endian CPU, we can start
005515r 2                               ; with the next byte regardless if this is a one or two byte
005515r 2                               ; operand, because we'll need the LSB one way or the other.
005515r 2                               ; We have a copy of the opcode on the stack, so we can now move
005515r 2                               ; to the next byte
005515r 2  F6 04                        inc 4,x
005517r 2  D0 02                        bne @l1
005519r 2  F6 05                        inc 5,x                 ; ( addr+1 u 0 )
00551Br 2               @l1:
00551Br 2  B5 02                        lda 2,x
00551Dr 2  D0 02                        bne @l2
00551Fr 2  D6 03                        dec 3,x
005521r 2               @l2:
005521r 2  D6 02                        dec 2,x                 ; ( addr+1 u-1 0 )
005523r 2               
005523r 2  A1 04                        lda (4,x)
005525r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x                 ; LSB of operand ( addr+1 u-1 LSB )
005527r 2  85 rr                        sta scratch+1           ; Save a copy in the scratch buffer
005529r 2               
005529r 2                               ; We still have a copy of the lengths byte in Y, which we use
005529r 2                               ; to see if we have a one-byte operand (and are done already)
005529r 2                               ; or a two-byte operand
005529r 2  98                           tya                     ; retrieve copy of lengths byte
00552Ar 2  2A                           rol                     ; shift bit 6 to bit 7
00552Br 2  10 14                        bpl _print_operand
00552Dr 2               
00552Dr 2                               ; We have a three-byte instruction, so we need to get the MSB
00552Dr 2                               ; of the operand. Move to the next byte
00552Dr 2  F6 04                        inc 4,x
00552Fr 2  D0 02                        bne @l3
005531r 2  F6 05                        inc 5,x                 ; ( addr+2 u-1 LSB )
005533r 2               @l3:
005533r 2  B5 02                        lda 2,x
005535r 2  D0 02                        bne @l4
005537r 2  D6 03                        dec 3,x
005539r 2               @l4:
005539r 2  D6 02                        dec 2,x                 ; ( addr+2 u-2 LSB )
00553Br 2               
00553Br 2  A1 04                        lda (4,x)
00553Dr 2  95 01                        sta 1,x                 ; MSB of operand ( addr+2 u-2 opr )
00553Fr 2  85 rr                        sta scratch+2           ; Save a copy in the scratch buffer
005541r 2               
005541r 2                               ; fall through to _print_operand
005541r 2               
005541r 2               _print_operand:
005541r 2               
005541r 2                               ; We arrive here with the lengths byte in Y, the address of the
005541r 2                               ; opcode table entry for the instruction on the stack ( addr+n
005541r 2                               ; u-n opr). We want the output to be nicely formatted in
005541r 2                               ; columns, so we use U.R. The maximal width of the number in
005541r 2                               ; decimal on an 16-bit addressed machine is five characters
005541r 2  CA                           dex
005542r 2  CA                           dex
005543r 2  A9 05                        lda #5
005545r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
005547r 2  74 01                        stz 1,x                 ; ( addr+n u-n opr 5 )
005549r 2               
005549r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_u_dot_r          ; U.R ( addr+n u-n )
00554Cr 2               
00554Cr 2  80 0B                        bra _print_mnemonic
00554Er 2               
00554Er 2               _no_operand:
00554Er 2                               ; We arrive here with the opcode table address on the stack,
00554Er 2                               ; the lengths byte in Y and ( addr u ). Since we want to have
00554Er 2                               ; a nicely formatted output, we need to indent the mnemonic by
00554Er 2                               ; five spaces.
00554Er 2  CA                           dex
00554Fr 2  CA                           dex
005550r 2  A9 05                        lda #5
005552r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
005554r 2  74 01                        stz 1,x                 ; ( addr u 5 )
005556r 2               
005556r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_spaces           ; ( addr u )
005559r 2               
005559r 2                               ; fall through to _print_mnemonic
005559r 2               
005559r 2               _print_mnemonic:
005559r 2                               ; We arrive here with the opcode table address on the stack and
005559r 2                               ; ( addr u | addr+n u-n ). Time to print the mnemonic.
005559r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
00555Cr 2               
00555Cr 2  CA                           dex
00555Dr 2  CA                           dex                     ; ( addr u ? )
00555Er 2  68                           pla                     ; MSB
00555Fr 2  95 01                        sta 1,x                 ; ( addr u MSB )
005561r 2  68                           pla                     ; LSB
005562r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x                 ; ( addr u addr-o )
005564r 2               
005564r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_count            ; ( addr u addr-o u-o )
005567r 2               
005567r 2                               ; The length of the mnemnonic string is in bits 2 to 0
005567r 2  74 01                        stz 1,x                 ; paranoid
005569r 2  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00556Br 2  29 07                        and #%00000111          ; ( addr u addr-o u-o )
00556Dr 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
00556Fr 2               
00556Fr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type             ; ( addr u )
005572r 2               
005572r 2                               ; Handle JSR by printing name of function, if available.
005572r 2                               ; scratch has opcode ($20 for JSR)
005572r 2                               ; scratch+1 and scratch+2 have address if it's a JSR.
005572r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch
005574r 2  C9 20                        cmp #$20
005576r 2  D0 59                        bne _not_jsr
005578r 2               
005578r 2                               ; It's a JSR.  Print 5 spaces as an offset.
005578r 2  CA                           dex
005579r 2  CA                           dex
00557Ar 2  A9 05                        lda #5
00557Cr 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
00557Er 2  74 01                        stz 1,x
005580r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_spaces
005583r 2               
005583r 2               ; Special handlers
005583r 2                               ; Handle literals specially.
005583r 2  A9 rr                        lda #<literal_runtime
005585r 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+1
005587r 2  D0 0C                        bne _not_literal
005589r 2  A9 rr                        lda #>literal_runtime
00558Br 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+2
00558Dr 2  D0 06                        bne _not_literal
00558Fr 2                               ; It's a literal.
00558Fr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_literal
005592r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _printing_done
005595r 2               
005595r 2               _not_literal:
005595r 2                               ; Handle string literals specially.
005595r 2  A9 rr                        lda #<sliteral_runtime
005597r 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+1
005599r 2  D0 0C                        bne _not_sliteral
00559Br 2  A9 rr                        lda #>sliteral_runtime
00559Dr 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+2
00559Fr 2  D0 06                        bne _not_sliteral
0055A1r 2                               ; It's a literal.
0055A1r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_sliteral
0055A4r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _printing_done
0055A7r 2               _not_sliteral:
0055A7r 2                               ; Handle 0branch
0055A7r 2  A9 rr                        lda #<zero_branch_runtime
0055A9r 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+1
0055ABr 2  D0 0C                        bne _not_0branch
0055ADr 2  A9 rr                        lda #>zero_branch_runtime
0055AFr 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+2
0055B1r 2  D0 06                        bne _not_0branch
0055B3r 2                               ; It's a 0branch.
0055B3r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_0branch
0055B6r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _printing_done
0055B9r 2               _not_0branch:
0055B9r 2                               ; Handle branch
0055B9r 2  A9 rr                        lda #<branch_runtime
0055BBr 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+1
0055BDr 2  D0 0C                        bne _not_branch
0055BFr 2  A9 rr                        lda #>branch_runtime
0055C1r 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+2
0055C3r 2  D0 06                        bne _not_branch
0055C5r 2                               ; It's a branch.
0055C5r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_branch
0055C8r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _printing_done
0055CBr 2               _not_branch:
0055CBr 2                               ; Try the generic JSR handler, which will use the target of the
0055CBr 2                               ; JSR as an XT and print the name if it exists.
0055CBr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_jsr
0055CEr 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _printing_done
0055D1r 2               
0055D1r 2               _not_jsr:
0055D1r 2                               ; See if the instruction is a jump (instruction still in A)
0055D1r 2                               ; (Strings start with a jump over the data.)
0055D1r 2  C9 4C                        cmp #$4C
0055D3r 2  D0 29                        bne _printing_done
0055D5r 2               
0055D5r 2                               ; We have a branch.  See if it's a string by looking for
0055D5r 2                               ; a JSR sliteral_runtime at the jump target address.
0055D5r 2                               ; The target address is in scratch+1 and scratch+2
0055D5r 2                               ; Use scratch+3 and scratch+4 here as we need to move
0055D5r 2                               ; the pointer.
0055D5r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1   ; Copy the pointer.
0055D7r 2  85 rr                        sta scratch+3
0055D9r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
0055DBr 2  85 rr                        sta scratch+4
0055DDr 2               
0055DDr 2                               ; Get the first byte at the jmp target address.
0055DDr 2  B2 rr                        lda (scratch+3)
0055DFr 2               
0055DFr 2  C9 20                        cmp #$20 ; check for JSR
0055E1r 2  D0 1B                        bne _printing_done
0055E3r 2                               ; Next byte
0055E3r 2  E6 rr                        inc scratch+3
0055E5r 2  D0 02                        bne @l1
0055E7r 2  E6 rr                        inc scratch+4
0055E9r 2               @l1:
0055E9r 2                               ; Check for string literal runtime
0055E9r 2  B2 rr                        lda (scratch+3)
0055EBr 2               
0055EBr 2  C9 rr                        cmp #<sliteral_runtime
0055EDr 2  D0 0F                        bne _printing_done
0055EFr 2                               ; Next byte
0055EFr 2  E6 rr                        inc scratch+3
0055F1r 2  D0 02                        bne @l2
0055F3r 2  E6 rr                        inc scratch+4
0055F5r 2               @l2:
0055F5r 2  B2 rr                        lda (scratch+3)
0055F7r 2               
0055F7r 2  C9 rr                        cmp #>sliteral_runtime
0055F9r 2  D0 03                        bne _printing_done
0055FBr 2               
0055FBr 2                               ; It's a string literal jump.
0055FBr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_sliteral_jump
0055FEr 2               _printing_done:
0055FEr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
005601r 2               
005601r 2                               ; Housekeeping: Next byte
005601r 2  F6 02                        inc 2,x
005603r 2  D0 02                        bne @l3
005605r 2  F6 03                        inc 3,x                 ; ( addr+1 u )
005607r 2               @l3:
005607r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus        ; ( addr+1 u-1 )
00560Ar 2               
00560Ar 2  B5 00                        lda 0,x                 ; All done?
00560Cr 2  15 01                        ora 1,x
00560Er 2  F0 07                        beq @done
005610r 2               
005610r 2  B5 01                        lda 1,x                 ; Catch mid-instruction ranges
005612r 2  30 03                        bmi @done
005614r 2               
005614r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _byte_loop          ; out of range for BRA
005617r 2               @done:
005617r 2                               ; Clean up and leave
005617r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp xt_two_drop         ; JSR/RTS
00561Ar 2               
00561Ar 2               ; Handlers for various special disassembled instructions:
00561Ar 2               ; String literal handler (both for inline strings and sliteral)
00561Ar 2               disasm_sliteral_jump:
00561Ar 2                               ; If we get here, we are at the jump for a constant string.
00561Ar 2                               ; Strings are compiled into the dictionary like so:
00561Ar 2                               ;           jmp a
00561Ar 2                               ;           <string data bytes>
00561Ar 2                               ;  a -->    jsr sliteral_runtime
00561Ar 2                               ;           <string address>
00561Ar 2                               ;           <string length>
00561Ar 2                               ;
00561Ar 2                               ; We have ( addr n ) on the stack where addr is the last
00561Ar 2                               ; byte of the address a in the above jmp instruction.
00561Ar 2                               ; Address a is in scratch+1 scratch+2.
00561Ar 2               
00561Ar 2                               ; Determine the distance of the jump so we end on the byte
00561Ar 2                               ; just before the JSR (sets us up for SLITERAL on next loop)
00561Ar 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
00561Dr 2  CA                           dex
00561Er 2  CA                           dex
00561Fr 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1
005621r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
005623r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
005625r 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
005627r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
00562Ar 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus
00562Dr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus
005630r 2                               ; (n jump_distance)
005630r 2                               ; Subtract the jump distance from the bytes left.
005630r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus
005633r 2                               ; ( new_n )
005633r 2                               ; Move to one byte before the target address
005633r 2  CA                           dex
005634r 2  CA                           dex
005635r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1
005637r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
005639r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
00563Br 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
00563Dr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus
005640r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap ; ( new_addr new_n )
005643r 2  60                           rts
005644r 2               
005644r 2               ; String literal handler
005644r 2               disasm_sliteral:
005644r 2  A9 53                        lda #'S'
005646r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a ; Print S before LITERAL so it becomes SLITERAL
005649r 2  A9 0D                        lda #str_disasm_lit     ; "LITERAL "
00564Br 2  20 rr rr                     jsr print_string_no_lf
00564Er 2               
00564Er 2                               ; ( addr u ) address of last byte of JSR address and bytes left on the stack.
00564Er 2                               ; We need to print the two values just after addr and move along two bytes
00564Er 2                               ; for each value.
00564Er 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap             ; switch to (u addr)
005651r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus
005654r 2               
005654r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
005657r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_fetch
00565Ar 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_u_dot            ; Print the address of the string
00565Dr 2                               ; Move along two bytes (already moved address one) to skip over the constant.
00565Dr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two
005660r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_plus
005663r 2               
005663r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
005666r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_question         ; Print the length of the string
005669r 2                               ; Move along to the very last byte of the data.
005669r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus
00566Cr 2               
00566Cr 2                               ; ( u addr+4 )
00566Cr 2                               ; Fix up the number of bytes left.
00566Cr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap            ; ( addr+4 u )
00566Fr 2  CA                           dex
005670r 2  CA                           dex
005671r 2  A9 04                        lda #4
005673r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
005675r 2  74 01                        stz 1,x
005677r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus            ; ( addr+4 u-4 )
00567Ar 2  60                           rts
00567Br 2               
00567Br 2               
00567Br 2               ; 0BRANCH handler
00567Br 2               disasm_0branch:
00567Br 2  A9 30                        lda #'0'
00567Dr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a ; Print 0 before BRANCH so it becomes 0BRANCH
005680r 2                               ; All other processing is identical, so fall into BRANCH handler
005680r 2               ; BRANCH handler
005680r 2               disasm_branch:
005680r 2  A9 0F                        lda #str_disasm_bra
005682r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr print_string_no_lf ; "BRANCH "
005685r 2                               ; The address after the 0BRANCH is handled the same as a literal.
005685r 2  80 05                        bra disasm_print_literal
005687r 2               
005687r 2               ; Literal handler
005687r 2               disasm_literal:
005687r 2  A9 0D                        lda #str_disasm_lit
005689r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr print_string_no_lf ; "LITERAL "
00568Cr 2               disasm_print_literal:
00568Cr 2                               ; ( addr u ) address of last byte of JSR and bytes left on the stack.
00568Cr 2                               ; We need to print the value just after the address and move along two bytes.
00568Cr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap ; switch to (u addr)
00568Fr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus
005692r 2               
005692r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
005695r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_question ; Print the value at the adress
005698r 2                               ; Move along two bytes (already moved address one) to skip over the constant.
005698r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus
00569Br 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap ; (addr+2 u)
00569Er 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus
0056A1r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus ; (addr+2 u-2)
0056A4r 2  60                           rts
0056A5r 2               
0056A5r 2               ; JSR handler
0056A5r 2               disasm_jsr:
0056A5r 2                               ; The address of the JSR is in scratch+1 and scratch+2.
0056A5r 2                               ; The current stack is already ( addr u ) where addr is the address of the last byte of
0056A5r 2                               ; the JSR target address, and we want to leave it like that so moving on to the next byte
0056A5r 2                               ; works properly.
0056A5r 2                               ; Put the target address on the stack and see if it's an XT.
0056A5r 2  CA                           dex
0056A6r 2  CA                           dex
0056A7r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1
0056A9r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
0056ABr 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
0056ADr 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
0056AFr 2                               ; ( xt )
0056AFr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_int_to_name
0056B2r 2                               ; int>name returns zero if we just don't know.
0056B2r 2  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0056B4r 2  15 01                        ora 1,x
0056B6r 2  F0 07                        beq _disasm_no_nt
0056B8r 2                               ; We now have a name token ( nt ) on the stack.
0056B8r 2                               ; Change it into the name and print it.
0056B8r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_name_to_string
0056BBr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
0056BEr 2  60                           rts
0056BFr 2               
0056BFr 2               _disasm_no_nt:
0056BFr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_drop ; the 0 indicating no name token
0056C2r 2                               ; See if the address is between underflow_1 and underflow_4,
0056C2r 2                               ; inclusive.
0056C2r 2  CA                           dex
0056C3r 2  CA                           dex
0056C4r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1
0056C6r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
0056C8r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
0056CAr 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
0056CCr 2                               ; ( jsr_address )
0056CCr 2                               ; Compare to lower underflow address
0056CCr 2  CA                           dex
0056CDr 2  CA                           dex
0056CEr 2  A9 rr                        lda #<underflow_1
0056D0r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
0056D2r 2  A9 rr                        lda #>underflow_1
0056D4r 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
0056D6r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr compare_16bit
0056D9r 2  F0 02                        beq _disasm_jsr_uflow_check_upper
0056DBr 2  B0 14                        bcs _disasm_jsr_unknown
0056DDr 2               _disasm_jsr_uflow_check_upper:
0056DDr 2                               ; Compare to upper underflow addresses
0056DDr 2  A9 rr                        lda #<underflow_4
0056DFr 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
0056E1r 2  A9 rr                        lda #>underflow_4
0056E3r 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
0056E5r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr compare_16bit
0056E8r 2  F0 02                        beq _disasm_jsr_soc
0056EAr 2  90 05                        bcc _disasm_jsr_unknown
0056ECr 2               _disasm_jsr_soc:
0056ECr 2                               ; It's an underflow check.
0056ECr 2  A9 0E                        lda #str_disasm_sdc
0056EEr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr print_string_no_lf  ; "STACK DEPTH CHECK"
0056F1r 2               _disasm_jsr_unknown:
0056F1r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two_drop
0056F4r 2  60                           rts
0056F5r 2               
0056F5r 2               
0056F5r 2               ; =========================================================
0056F5r 2               oc_index_table:
0056F5r 2                       ; Lookup table for the instruction data (length of instruction in
0056F5r 2                       ; bytes, length of mnemonic in bytes, mnemonic string). This is used by
0056F5r 2                       ; the assembler as well.
0056F5r 2               
0056F5r 2                       ; Opcodes 00-0F
0056F5r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc00, oc01, oc__, oc__, oc04, oc05, oc06, oc__
0056F9r 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056FDr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005705r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc08, oc09, oc0a, oc__, oc0c, oc0d, oc0e, oc0f
005709r 2  rr rr rr rr  
00570Dr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005715r 2               
005715r 2                       ; Opcodes 10-1F
005715r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc10, oc11, oc12, oc__, oc14, oc15, oc16, oc17
005719r 2  rr rr rr rr  
00571Dr 2  rr rr rr rr

0058E9r 2  rr rr rr rr  
0058EDr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0058F5r 2               
0058F5r 2               
0058F5r 2               ; =========================================================
0058F5r 2               oc_table:
0058F5r 2                       ; Opcode data table for the disassember, which is also used by the
0058F5r 2                       ; assembler. Each entry starts with a "lengths byte":
0058F5r 2               
0058F5r 2                       ;       bit 7-6:  Length of instruction in bytes (1 to 3 for the 65c02)
0058F5r 2                       ;       bit 5-3:  unused
0058F5r 2                       ;       bit 2-0:  Length of mnemonic in chars (3 to 7)
0058F5r 2               
0058F5r 2                       ; To convert a line in this table to a Forth string of the mnemonic,
0058F5r 2                       ; use the COUNT word on the address of the lengths byte to get
0058F5r 2                       ; ( addr u ) and then mask all but the bits 2-0 of the TOS.
0058F5r 2               
0058F5r 2                       ; To make debugging easier, we keep the raw numbers for the lengths of
0058F5r 2                       ; the instruction and mnemonicis and let the assembler do the math
0058F5r 2                       ; required to shift and add. The actual mnemonic string follows after
0058F5r 2                       ; and is not zero terminated because we have the length in bits 2 to 0.
0058F5r 2               
0058F5r 2  83 62 72 6B  	oc00:	.byte 2*64+3, "brk"              ; enforce the signature byte
0058F9r 2  87 6F 72 61  	oc01:	.byte 2*64+7, "ora.zxi"
0058FDr 2  2E 7A 78 69  
005901r 2               ;      (oc02)
005901r 2               ;      (oc03)
005901r 2  85 74 73 62          oc04:   .byte 2*64+5, "tsb.z"
005905r 2  2E 7A        
005907r 2  85 6F 72 61  	oc05:	.byte 2*64+5, "ora.z"
00590Br 2  2E 7A        
00590Dr 2  85 61 73 6C  	oc06:	.byte 2*64+5, "asl.z"
005911r 2  2E 7A        
005913r 2               ;      (oc07)
005913r 2  43 70 68 70  	oc08:	.byte 1*64+3, "php"
005917r 2  85 6F 72 61  	oc09:	.byte 2*64+5, "ora.#"
00591Br 2  2E 23        
00591Dr 2  45 61 73 6C  	oc0a:	.byte 1*64+5, "asl.a"
005921r 2  2E 61

005D86r 2  2E 78

005D8Cr 2  37           
005D8Dr 2               
005D8Dr 2                       ; Common routine for opcodes that are not supported by the 65c02
005D8Dr 2  01 3F        	oc__:	.byte 1, "?"
005D8Fr 2               
005D8Fr 2               ; used to calculate size of assembled disassembler code
005D8Fr 2               disassembler_end:
005D8Fr 2               
005D8Fr 1               .endif
005D8Fr 1               
005D8Fr 1               platform_bye:
005D8Fr 1               kernel_init:
005D8Fr 1               .ifdef VIA1_BASE
005D8Fr 1  A9 FF            lda #$FF
005D91r 1  8D 82 FF         sta DDRB
005D94r 1  8D 83 FF         sta DDRA
005D97r 1  A9 01            lda #1
005D99r 1  8D 80 FF         sta PORTB
005D9Cr 1  9C 81 FF         stz PORTA
005D9Fr 1               .endif
005D9Fr 1               .ifdef ENABLE_RAM_EXPANSION
005D9Fr 1               .if ENABLE_RAM_EXPANSION = 1
005D9Fr 1  64 rr        stz ram_expansion_address
005DA1r 1  64 rr        stz ram_expansion_address + 1
005DA3r 1               .endif
005DA3r 1               .endif
005DA3r 1               
005DA3r 1               
005DA3r 1  20 rr rr     jsr acia_init
005DA6r 1               .ifdef timer_init
005DA6r 1  20 rr rr         jsr timer_init
005DA9r 1               .endif
005DA9r 1               .ifdef video_init
005DA9r 1                   jsr video_init
005DA9r 1               .endif
005DA9r 1               .ifdef ps2_init
005DA9r 1                   jsr ps2_init
005DA9r 1               .endif
005DA9r 1               .ifdef cf_init
005DA9r 1  20 rr rr         jsr cf_init
005DACr 1               .endif
005DACr 1               .ifdef lcd_init
005DACr 1  20 rr rr         jsr lcd_init
005DAFr 1               .endif
005DAFr 1               .ifdef spi_init
005DAFr 1  20 rr rr         jsr spi_init
005DB2r 1               .endif
005DB2r 1               .ifdef kb_init
005DB2r 1                   jsr kb_init
005DB2r 1               .endif
005DB2r 1               
005DB2r 1  DA A2 00 BD      printascii welcome_message
005DB6r 1  rr rr F0 06  
005DBAr 1  20 rr rr E8  
005DC1r 1               
005DC1r 1                   ; lda #<dictionary
005DC1r 1                   ; sta util_tmp
005DC1r 1                   ; lda #>dictionary
005DC1r 1                   ; sta util_tmp + 1
005DC1r 1               
005DC1r 1                   ; jsr calculate_free_mem
005DC1r 1                   ; lda tmp_var + 1
005DC1r 1                   ; ldx tmp_var
005DC1r 1                   ; jsr print16
005DC1r 1               
005DC1r 1                   ; printascii free_message
005DC1r 1               
005DC1r 1               
005DC1r 1  4C rr rr         jmp forth
005DC4r 1               
005DC4r 1               v_nmi:
005DC4r 1               
005DC4r 1                   ; jsr calculate_free_mem
005DC4r 1                   ; lda tmp_var + 1
005DC4r 1                   ; ldx tmp_var
005DC4r 1                   ; jsr print16
005DC4r 1               
005DC4r 1                   ; printascii free_message
005DC4r 1  DA A2 00 BD      printascii ready_message
005DC8r 1  rr rr F0 06  
005DCCr 1  20 rr rr E8  
005DD3r 1               
005DD3r 1  4C rr rr         jmp xt_abort
005DD6r 1               
005DD6r 1               
005DD6r 1               
005DD6r 1               .ifdef io_read_sector_address
005DD6r 1               io_read_sector:
005DD6r 1  4C rr rr         jmp io_read_sector_address        ; jump to read sector routine
005DD9r 1               
005DD9r 1               io_write_sector:
005DD9r 1  4C rr rr         jmp io_write_sector_address        ; jump to read sector routine
005DDCr 1               .endif
005DDCr 1               
005DDCr 1               
005DDCr 1               kernel_putc:
005DDCr 1                   ; """Print a single character to the console. """
005DDCr 1                   ;; Send_Char - send character in A out serial port.
005DDCr 1                   ;; Uses: A (original value restored)
005DDCr 1               send_char:
005DDCr 1  48               pha
005DDDr 1                   .ifdef char_out
005DDDr 1                   jsr char_out
005DDDr 1                   .endif
005DDDr 1                   .ifdef acia_out
005DDDr 1  20 rr rr         jsr acia_out
005DE0r 1                   .endif
005DE0r 1               send_char_exit:
005DE0r 1               .ifdef lcd_print
005DE0r 1  20 rr rr         jsr lcd_print
005DE3r 1               .endif
005DE3r 1  68               pla
005DE4r 1  60               rts
005DE5r 1               
005DE5r 1               
005DE5r 1                       ;; Get_Char - get a character from the serial port into A.
005DE5r 1                       ;; Set the carry flag if char is valid.
005DE5r 1                       ;; Return immediately with carry flag clear if no char available.
005DE5r 1                       ;; Uses: A (return value)
005DE5r 1               
005DE5r 1               Get_Char:
005DE5r 1  20 rr rr         jsr acia_getc
005DE8r 1  90 01            bcc get_ps2_char                ; check keyboard buffer if nothing from ACIA
005DEAr 1                                                   ; Carry is set to show we got a character
005DEAr 1  60               rts                             ; Return
005DEBr 1               
005DEBr 1               get_ps2_char:                       ; no ACIA char available, try to get from KB buffer
005DEBr 1               .ifdef ps2_get_char
005DEBr 1                   jsr ps2_get_char
005DEBr 1               .endif
005DEBr 1  90 01            bcc get_kb_char
005DEDr 1  60               rts
005DEEr 1               get_kb_char:
005DEEr 1               .ifdef kb_get_char
005DEEr 1                   jsr kb_get_char
005DEEr 1               .endif
005DEEr 1               exit:                         ; Indicate no char available.
005DEEr 1  60               rts                             ; return
005DEFr 1               
005DEFr 1               kernel_getc:
005DEFr 1                   ; """Get a single character from the keyboard (waits for key).
005DEFr 1                   ; """
005DEFr 1                   ;; Get_Char_Wait - same as Get_Char only blocking.
005DEFr 1                   ;; Uses: A (return value)
005DEFr 1               Get_Char_Wait:
005DEFr 1  20 rr rr         jsr Get_Char
005DF2r 1  90 FB            bcc Get_Char_Wait
005DF4r 1  60               rts
005DF5r 1               
005DF5r 1               
005DF5r 1               v_irq:                          ; IRQ handler
005DF5r 1  48                   pha
005DF6r 1  5A                   phy
005DF7r 1                       ; lda #'.'
005DF7r 1                       ; jsr kernel_putc
005DF7r 1                       ; check if bit 7 of IFR is set
005DF7r 1               .ifdef IFR
005DF7r 1  AD 8D FF             lda IFR
005DFAr 1  10 0B                bpl irq_not_from_via  ; Interrupt not from VIA, exit
005DFCr 1               
005DFCr 1  29 08                and #$08        ; ps2 has priority
005DFEr 1  D0 07                bne v_irq_ps2
005E00r 1  AD 8D FF             lda IFR
005E03r 1  29 40                and #$40
005E05r 1  D0 02                bne v_irq_timer
005E07r 1               irq_not_from_via:
005E07r 1               .endif
005E07r 1               .ifdef KB_IFR
005E07r 1               v_kb_irq:
005E07r 1                       lda KB_IFR
005E07r 1                       bpl v_irq_exit
005E07r 1                       and #$40
005E07r 1                       bne v_kb_irq_timer
005E07r 1                       bra v_irq_exit
005E07r 1               .endif
005E07r 1               
005E07r 1               v_irq_ps2:
005E07r 1                   .ifdef ps2_irq
005E07r 1                       lda time
005E07r 1                       sta last_ps2_time
005E07r 1                       lda time+1
005E07r 1                       sta last_ps2_time+1
005E07r 1                       lda time+2
005E07r 1                       sta last_ps2_time+2
005E07r 1                       lda time+3
005E07r 1                       sta last_ps2_time+3
005E07r 1               
005E07r 1                       jsr ps2_irq
005E07r 1               
005E07r 1                   .endif
005E07r 1  80 27                bra v_irq_exit
005E09r 1               
005E09r 1               .ifdef T1CL
005E09r 1               v_irq_timer:
005E09r 1  AD 84 FF             lda T1CL
005E0Cr 1                       ; clear timer interrupt
005E0Cr 1                   .ifdef timer_irq
005E0Cr 1  20 rr rr             jsr timer_irq
005E0Fr 1                   .endif
005E0Fr 1  20 rr rr             jsr Get_Char ; Check if a char is waiting to be able to break on CTRL-C
005E12r 1                       ; check if there is a char waiting to be printed to the lcd
005E12r 1                       ; lda lcd_char
005E12r 1                       ; beq v_exit
005E12r 1                       ; jsr lcd_print
005E12r 1                       ; stz lcd_char
005E12r 1               
005E12r 1               
005E12r 1  90 1C                bcc v_irq_exit      ; no character waiting, exit normally
005E14r 1  C9 03                cmp #$03            ; check if CTRL-C
005E16r 1  D0 18                bne v_irq_exit      ; not CTRL-C, exit normally
005E18r 1  DA A2 00 BD          printascii abort_message    ; was a CTRL_C
005E1Cr 1  rr rr F0 06  
005E20r 1  20 rr rr E8  
005E27r 1  7A                   ply                         ; pull what the ISR pushed
005E28r 1  68                   pla
005E29r 1  28                   plp                         ; pull status register
005E2Ar 1  68                   pla                         ; pull return address
005E2Br 1  68                   pla
005E2Cr 1               
005E2Cr 1  58                   cli                         ; clear interrupt disabled bit
005E2Dr 1  4C rr rr             jmp xt_abort
005E30r 1               
005E30r 1               .endif
005E30r 1               v_kb_irq_timer:
005E30r 1               .ifdef kb_time
005E30r 1                   lda KB_T1CL ; clear timer interrupt
005E30r 1                   inc kb_time
005E30r 1                   bne v_irq_exit
005E30r 1               
005E30r 1               .endif
005E30r 1                   ;jsr kb_scan
005E30r 1               v_irq_exit:
005E30r 1  7A               ply
005E31r 1  68               pla
005E32r 1  40               rti
005E33r 1               
005E33r 1  20 62 79 74  free_message: .byte " bytes free", $0D, 0
005E37r 1  65 73 20 66  
005E3Br 1  72 65 65 0D  
005E40r 1  52 65 61 64  ready_message: .byte "Ready", $0D, 0
005E44r 1  79 0D 00     
005E47r 1  57 65 6C 63  welcome_message: .byte "Welcome to Planck 6502", $0D, "Type 'words' for available words", $0D, 0
005E4Br 1  6F 6D 65 20  
005E4Fr 1  74 6F 20 50  
005E80r 1  0D 0A 00     abort_message: .byte AscCR, AscLF, 0
005E83r 1               
005E83r 1               .segment "VECTORS"
000000r 1               
000000r 1  rr rr        .word v_nmi
000002r 1  rr rr        .word v_reset
000004r 1  rr rr        .word v_irq
000004r 1
